The communal bank San Jacinto is located in the San José del Tambo parish, San Jacinto region, belonging to the Chillanes canton. The members of this bank devote themselves to agriculture, mainly growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and practicing animal husbandry. 

Ciro devotes himself to growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and to animal husbandry. The producer buys his supplies at the local Agro market and sells his products at the market of the same parish every weekend. 

He is seeking the loan for the purchase of compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids to prevent infestations in the crops and keep the products in good condition, and to buy feed for the animals that he raises in order to sell them later at a better price. 

The loan will provide him support in meeting his financial needs and improving the quality of the product and his agricultural activities. He faces challenges such as falling prices for the products he sells, as well as the middlemen. His dream is to be able to buy a farm so he may plant a little more in order to make better profits for the well-being of his family. 

He characterizes himself as an easygoing man, honorable and very responsible, prompt with his payments. He likes to play sports and he appreciates the holidays and especially the Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids, and to buy feed for the animals.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina nació en la ciudad de Coya (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú) y tiene 49 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de hermosa relación tiene once hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora, crianza de animales menores y venta de cerveza, ella tiene una pequeña picantería donde vende sus productos. Ya son 15 años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

El crédito que requiere Paulina es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cerveza y maíz. 

Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the city of Coya (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú).  She’s 49 years old, married and her beautiful relationship produced eleven children.  Currently, she’s living in the city of her birth and where she carries out her activities.  She manufactures “chicha de jora” (corn-based drink), raises small farm animals and sells beer.  She has a small snack bar where she sells her products.  She’s been in business 15 years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  The loan Paulina needs is to buy merchandise like beer and corn, for example.

The “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” (Urubamba Lord of Miracles) communal bank meets monthly in the Pisaq District, Calca Province (Cusco, Perú).  Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like beer and corn.

loans.name: Rosa Natividad

texts.es:
Rosa Natividad tiene 50 años de edad, es casada vive con el esposo y con sus dos hijos de veinte y dos y treinta años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Rosa se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar una casa para poder vivir tranquilos con la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser tranquila, honrada y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Rosa Natividad is 50 years old. She is married. She lives with her husband and two children who are 20 and 30 years old in the Chillanes canton, in the province of Bolívar.

The SAN JACINTO communal bank is located in the San José del Tambo Parrish and San Jacinto precinct which is in the Chillanes canton. The members of the communal bank are farmers. They primarily farm corn, cocoa, bananas, oranges and raise animals.

Rosa grows corn, cocoa, bananas, oranges and she raises animals. She buys and sells her products in the San José del Tambo market every weekend. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, farm consumables, urea and other items for fertilizers to get rid of pests in her crops to keep them healthy. This loan is also to purchase food for the animals she is raising, so she can sell them at a better price. 

This loan will serve as support to supplement her economic needs and improve the quality of her products and her farming ventures. She is facing challenges like the decline of prices for the products she sells. Her dream is to be able to buy a house so she can live peacefully with her family. 

She is known for being calm, honest, very responsible and punctual with her payments. She likes to go out. She likes parties, especially during Carnival.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, seeds, farm consumables,  urea and other items for fertilizers, liquids and food for animals

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
Elisabeth nació en la ciudad de Coya (Pisac, Cusco, Perú) y tiene 27 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija (Luz Diana de 10 años de edad). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella  se dedica a la venta de artesanía y tiene un puesto de venta en feria artesanal de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Pisaq, ella vende collares, mantas, mochilas, pulseras, agua mineral y otras cosas más. Su esposo Arístides se encarga de la elaboración de artesanía. Ya son 7 años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. 

Elisabeth va regresar a la ciudad de Coya para abrir una tienda de abarrotes y por ese motivo requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas de azúcar, bolsas de arroz y otras cosas más.   

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Elisabeth was born in the city of Coya (Pisac, Cusco, Perú).  She’s 27 years old, in a common law relationship and has a daughter, Luz Diana, 10.  Currently, she’s living in the city of Pisaq where she carries out her activities.  She sells crafts and has a stand in the crafts market in Pisac’s main square.  She sells necklaces, blankets, backpacks, bracelets, mineral water and other things.  Her husband, Arístides, makes the crafts.  They’ve been in this business for 7 years now and they do very well thanks to the effort they put into their work.

Elisabeth is going to move back to the city of Coya and open a grocery store and this is why she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, sacks of rice and other things.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank meets monthly in Pisac District, Calca Province, (Cusco, Perú). Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, sacks of rice and other things.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tres hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la elaboración y distribución de artesanía de tipo platería. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Marivel  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como alambre y otras cosas más.

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Marivel was born in the city of Pisaq (Cusco, Perú).  She’s 34 years old, married and has three children.  Currently, she’s living in the city of Pisaq where she carries out her activities.  She makes and sells all sorts of silver crafts.  She’s been in this business for 15 years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Marivel wants the loan to buy supplies like wire and other things.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank meets monthly in Pisaq District, Calca Province, (Cusco, Perú). Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wire and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sauce condiments, cassava flour, and corn

loans.name: Giovannia Maria

texts.es:
Doña Giovannia es comerciante, vende cosmeticos, bisituria, perecederos, tambien da clases de manualidades, y se ayuda con mas ingresos. Es casada, madre de una hija, Su esposo labora en cartera. Con prestamos en Afodenic ha venido adar mejor techo a su pequeña hija, siendo de gran sastifaccion personal.
Como objetivo es  la construccion de su casa, pues viven en casa de su suegra en un cuarto aparte y que han venido haciendo mejoras, para el bienestar comun. Pero en planes futuro esperan comprar un terreno y tener un techo propio.
Con esta nueva solicitud, sera para la ampliacion del cuarto, en donde comprara lamimas de zinc, perlines, arena, cemento, bloques, hierro y ceramica. Logrando mas espacio.
texts.en:
Giovannia is a merchant selling cosmetics, costume jewelry and perishable items.  She also teaches crafts-making courses that provide extra income for her.  She’s married and the mother of a daughter.  Her husband’s a mailman.  With Afodenic loans she’s been able to provide housing for her daughter which is of great personal satisfaction.

Her goal is to build a house since they currently live at her mother-in-law’s house, in a separate room, and have been doing improvements to it for the common good.  However, in future they’d like to buy a lot and have a house of their own.

This new loan request is to enlarge the room.  She will buy zinc metal sheets, purlins, sand, cement, concrete blocks, iron rods and tile thus obtaining more space.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; ella es casada y tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende tomates,zanahorias,pepinos,lechugas entre otras verduras, la socia vende en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 3:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m y los días domingos lleva a lugares como los mercados de San Sebastian,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor como tomates, zanahorias y lechugas.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de maíz.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Juntos Podemos” (Together We Can) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

Jesusa, 43, is the member.  She’s married and has four children.  She works in her business selling vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, carrots, cucumbers and lettuce, among other vegetables.  She sells in Huancaro market from 3am until 5pm and on Sundays goes to such places as the San Sebastian markets.  Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the business selling vegetables and is asking for a loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, carrots and lettuce at wholesale.  The other group members sell crafts, vegetables, fruit, groceries and corn.  The member thanks those who share her dream and commits to make her payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Segnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Nicole est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Marie Nicole est âgée de 39 ans et vit au  Bénin. Marie Nicole est mariée à un certain Jean Marc. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Marie Nicole n’a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Marie Nicole mène comme activité depuis vingt ans, la vente des boissons en cannettes. Marie Nicole s’approvisionne au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie Nicole sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEGNON, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group SEGNON is composed of three persons who are friends. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Marie Nicole, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Jean Marc. They have three children who are all in school. 

Marie Nicole never attended school. To support herself and her children, Sinatou has been running a business selling canned beverages for 20 years. She gets her supplies from Togo, a country neighboring Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Marie Nicole and the other members of the group SEGNON are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy can beverages

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 58 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión cinco hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, él se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo cerámica, él lleva a la ciudad de Lima y vende sus productos a diferentes centros artesanales. Ya son 35 años que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Francisco requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como laca, barniz, arcilla y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in Pisaq (Peru). He is 58, married, and has five children. He currently lives in the city of his birth, where he works. He makes ceramics, bringing his products to Lima to sell in different craft centers. He has been an artist for 35 years, and it is going very well for him thanks to the hard work that he puts into his job.

Francisco needs this loan to purchase materials such as lacquer, varnish, and clay.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq district of the Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known as a very touristic area, as well as for being a commercial center. It is known for the traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as lacquer, varnish, clay, and other items.

loans.name: Chancelle Orlec Suresness

texts.fr:
Cliente de 33 ans, mariée et mère 2 enfants dont l'age varient entre 2 et 8 ans.A l'obtention de son bac ne pouvant pas poursuivre ses études universitaires, il se lance dans la vente des ensembles vestes d'hommes, des chemises et pantalons en jean.
ses ventes sont de 20.000 frs a 100.000 frs par jour , surtout pendant les périodes de fête.
A l'octroi  de son prêt elle va acheter des ballots d'ensemble des vestes hommes, qu'elle fait nettoyer et vend auprès de ses clients, qui  sont en général  les hommes et les jeunes gens qui aiment s'habiller.
Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir dans peu de temps une boutique d'habits pour pouvoir aider sa famille
texts.en:
This client is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children, from 2 to 8 years old. A high school graduate but not able to pursue her education at a university, she got stated in selling men's suits, shirts, and jeans. Her sales amount to 20,000 to 100,000 francs per day, especially during the holidays. 

Upon being granted her loan, she is going to buy bales of men's suits that she has cleaned and sells to her customers, who are generally men and young people who like to dress up. Her ambition is to open a clothing shop soon in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy bales of outfits, jackets, and men's pants

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene nació en la comunidad de Amaru de la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 35 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo cerámica, ella compra artesanía de tipo cerámica sin pintar pues su labor de la socia es darle color y brill. ella también vende sus productos en la feria artesanal de la ciudad de Pisaq y pertenece a la asociación de artesanos Mariscal Castilla. Ya son 5 años que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Irene requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como pintura, laca, barniz, arcilla y otras cosas más.

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Irene was born in the Amaru community in Pisaq city (Perú). She is 35, is in a common-law marriage, and has three children. She currently lives and works in Pisaq. She makes ceramic art; she buys all types of unpainted ceramics and gives them colour and shine. She sells her products in Pisaq's art market. She belongs to the Mariscal Castilla association of artists. She has been an artist for five years and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into her work.

Irene needs this loan to purchase materials such as paint, lacquer, varnish, clay, and other items.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq district of the Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristic area, as well as for being a commercial center. It is known for the traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as paint, lacquer, varnish, and clay.

loans.name: Dagbegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DAGBEGNON est composé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Suzanne Claire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Suzanne Claire est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Suzanne Claire est mariée à un  agent de sécurité du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont un est à leur charge. Suzanne Claire n’a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Suzanne Claire mène comme activité depuis trente ans la vente du maïs à son domicile. Suzanne Claire s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Suzanne Claire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DAGBEGNON, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group DAGBEGNON is composed of two persons who are friends. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost its businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Suzanne Claire, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a security guard by the name of Marcellin. They have four children, all in school. One of the children is still in their care. 

Suzanne Claire never attended school. To support herself and her children, she has been running a business selling corn out of her home for thirty years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Suzanne Claire and the other member of the group DAGBEGNON are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: El Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Quesillo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Rosa Carolina quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado desde hace varios años. Ella tiene una venta aproximada de 20,000 córdobas mensuales y una inversión de 18,000 córdobas mensuales. 
Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería en especial blusas ya que tiene mayor demanda.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ivecta comerciante de ropa y calzado,  y Rosa quien también vende ropa desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The Quesillo group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. The coordinator is Señora Rosa Carolina, who has sold shoes and clothing for several years. She has monthly sales of approximately 20,000 córdobas, and invests 18,000 córdobas monthly.
With this loan she will purchase merchandise, especially blouses, because these are in the greatest demand.

The other group members are Ivecta, a shoe and clothing merchant; and Rosa, who has also sold clothing for eight years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise; clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 8 años. Allí tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos, carnes y en general productos de la canasta familias que las amas de casa compran diariamente en pequeñas cantidades. Su negocio funciona desde hace 4 años atendido por él y su cónyuge. A su negocio se le nota el buen manejo que esta pareja ha tenido pues el progreso de este es muy visible. Su filosofía de servicio los lleva a que sean muy reconocidos en la zona objetivo de su mercado y cada día crece su clientela, pero su capital de trabajo cada día es insuficiente para la proyección de crecimiento que tienen como su meta principal. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, con el cual comprarán mercancía variada de la que más rota, pues un stock de ella seria significativo para su diario crecimiento. Su sueño es tener una sucursal de este mismo negocio pues su experiencia le indica que ordenadamente pude su familia progresar y este es su plan para que sus hijos logren el mayor bienestar que le sea posible y potencialicen su éxito futuro. Su mayor desafío es el transporte diario de sus productos, pues no es fácil tener la disponibilidad de un vehículo que le preste el servicio, por eso más adelante proyecta tener uno propio. Su negocio presenta buenos índices de liquidez, sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rápidamente, lo mismo que sus inventarios y sus índices de rentabilidad demuestran eficiencia y solvencia para aprovecharla para compromisos futuros.
texts.en:
Álvaro lives in the municipality of Soledad with his wife and their two children, ages 5 and 8. There he has a store where he sells food, groceries, beverages, meat and basic supplies that housewives buy in small quantities every day. He has had his business for 4 years and it is run by himself and his wife. One notes the store’s visible improvements due to this couple’s fine management. 

Their philosophy of service makes them very well known in the area they serve and their customer base is growing every day. However, their daily working capital is insufficient for the projected growth they have as their principal goal. This is the reason they approached Kiva credit so that they can buy a variety of merchandise that has the greatest turnover. Such a supply of goods would be significant for their daily growth.

Álvaro’s dream is to establish a branch of his business, since his experience indicates that his family can progress only in an orderly way. This is his plan so that his children will have the greatest sense of well being possible, thereby increasing their likelihood of a successful future. His greatest challenge is the daily transportation of his products, since it is not easy to find an available vehicle to borrow; consequently in the future he plans to have his own. His business shows a good liquidity index, his accounts receivable turn over quickly, as does his inventory and his profitability index displays efficiency and solvency, which can be utilized in future commitments.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of food, groceries, beverages and basic family supplies to sell.

loans.name: Francisca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Francisca lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Julia coordinadora del grupo. Ella se dedica a la realización de rosquillas y repostería desde hace 10 años. Ella con el crédito comprara materia prima maíz, cuajada, dulce…etc. necesario para la producción de este tradicional bocadillo.

Las otras integrantes son Juana quien vende cosméticos desde hace 2 años, Gema Guadalupe quien vende repostería desde hace 2 años y Junieth vende repostería.
texts.en:
The “Francisca” group is composed of four hardworking women.  One of them is Julia, group Coordinator.  She has been making “rosquillas” (traditional cookies) and pastries for the last ten years.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials: corn, caramel, cheese, etc. needed for the production of this traditional snack.

The other group members are Juana who has been selling cosmetics for the last two years, Gema Guadalupe who has been selling pastries for the last two years and Junieth who sells pastries.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to keep growing her sales.

loans.name: Yelian 05 Group

texts.fr: YELIAN 05 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Marcelle Henriette. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marcelle Henriette est âgée de 52 ans. Marcelle Henriette est mariée à un certain Etienne. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Marcelle Henriette vit ensemble avec son mari. Depuis une trentaine d'année, Marcelle Henriette vend divers articles (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, etc.) et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. Marcelle Henriette s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Marcelle Henriette et aux autres membres de son groupe YELIAN 05, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
YELIAN 05 is a group composed of three persons whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Marcelle Henriette. The group members live in the same district. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group is requesting its first loan from ALIDé. 

Marcelle Henriette is 52 years old and married to a man named Etienne. They have four children; some are in school. She lives together with her husband. For about thirty years, she has been selling a variety of goods (pasta, canned foods, etc.) and mobile phone cards out of her home. This enables her to support herself and to ensure her family's needs are met. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

This initial loan will certainly allow her and the other members of the group YELIAN 05 to boost their businesses and to grow their customer base, as well as their revenues.

loans.use: to buy canned foods, pasta, and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
La señora Inés es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde temprana edad empezó a trabajar para sustentar a sus hijos, los cuales son hombres y mujeres de bien hace según expreso. Desde hace 10 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado en los que invierte mensual alrededor de 11,000 córdobas y vende 24,600 córdobas. 
Ella con el crédito compro chinelas, blusas, pantalones…
texts.en: Señora Inés is a hardworking and enterprising woman who started working at an early age to provide for her children, who she says have grown to become men and women of good character. For the last 10 years she has sold clothes and footwear. Each month she invests approximately 11,000 córdobas in merchandise and has roughly 24,600 córdobas in gross sales. With this loan she purchased sandals, blouses and pants.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es muy trabajadora, tiene varios años, de dicarse a la venta de leña, la venta de maiz, frijoles, el cual ofrece en su carreta, cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, para vender y su esposo quien es que se encarga del cultivo, ya que el setenta por ciento de sus ventas son de sus propios cultivos que hace, en una manzanas de tierras que tiene y que aprovecha a sembrar.
Para poder cultivar las tierras fue posible con financiamiento que Afodenic, ha dado y que ha venido trabajando en dieciseis ciclos y que ha hecho posible las entradas economicas a mi hogar.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de semilla, abono, fertilizantes, y leña y seguir con sus ventas. ya que se esta terminando la cosecha de maiz  y seguira con  la produccion de frijoles, ya que estamos en invierno, lo cual sera de gran beneficios.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is very hardworking, and for several years has sold firewood, corn, and beans from her cart.  Her son helps her sell these items, and her husband is in charge of growing the crops.  Sixty percent of her sales are from her own crops in a plot of land that she owns.  She has taken advantage of the space by planting seeds.

She was able to grow crops on her land with financing from Afodenic.  She has had sixteen loans from Afodenic, and this has made it possible to improve her household income.

This new loan will be for the purchase of seed, compost, fertilizer and firewood so she can continue her sales.  Now that it is winter and the corn harvest is over, she will grow beans, and the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for her next bean crop and to buy firewood to increase her sales.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres D. la Ciudad D. Pilar se unieron con el propósito D. generar un mejor porvenir para sus familias e hijos. Por medio del trabajo conjunto desean ir progresando y volverse unas buenas micro empresarias. El grupo ya está en el 1 ciclo. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas.
La señor Rosalba se dedica a la compra y venta D. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas, calzados y demás. Por medio D. este trabajo ella ha logrado salir adelante y paliar todo los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Uno D. sus proyectos es tener un local donD. pueda ofrecer sus productos y D. esa forma atraer a más clientes, lo que le generará más ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los artículos que venD., como ser frazadas, sabanas, y demás ya que por medio D. esto podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que si obtiene el crédito le será D. gran ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Twelve women from the city of Pilar joined together with the intention of generating a better future for their families and children.  By working collectively they hope to progress so as to become good micro entrepreneurs. The group is in their first loan cycle.  The women describe themselves as hard working, self sacrificing and fighters. 

Rosalba buys and sells all kinds of goods, such as blankets, sheets, shoes and other items.  As a result of this she has been able to get ahead and ease the pressure on all her daily household expenditures.  One of her plans is to have a store where she can sell her goods and as such attract more customers, which will generate more income.  

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy the goods she sells, such as blankets, sheets and more. With this she will be able to meet her customers' demand.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity this gives her, for if she is granted a loan it will be of great benefit to her business.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, sheets and other items to stock her shop.

loans.name: Priscila Nohemi

texts.es:
La señora Priscila Nohemi es casada, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los tres años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, la confección de playeras, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de su familia, y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de telas para la confección de playeras, y de esta forma mejorar su producción, espera que su negocio sea prospero.
texts.en:
Priscila Nohemí, 39, is married.  She went to three year of elementary school.  She has five children; there of them are in school.  She manufactures t-shirts.  She started the business with help from her family and to date has twenty-five years’ experience.  Her husband helps her economically.

She wants to ask for a loan to buy fabric to make t-shirts to improve production.  She hopes that her business will be profitable.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make t-shirts.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Judith  es una mujer D. 48 años D. edad, ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Las Hormiguitas “la cual la integran 08 personas   entre hombres y mujeres, responsables y trabajadoras.
Judith se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, ese negocio comenzó gracias a que una  amiga le motivo para iniciar su propio negocio, poco a poco y con su carisma Judith ha podido captar  más clientes y D. ese modo ha mejorado sus ganancias. Judith  es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo el cual ha sido su motivación para seguir adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo Judith ha apoyado en su educación y mejorar su vivienda. Con  el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para invertir en sus productos comprando talco, colonias, cremas entre otros productos. A futuro Judith le gustaría tener restaurante donD. ofrezca variedades D. platos.
texts.en:
Judith’s a 48-year-old woman that belongs to the “Las Hormiguitas” (Little Ants) communal bank which has 8 members, both men and women, who are responsible and hardworking.

Judith sells beauty products, a business she started thanks to a girlfriend who motivated her to start her own business.  Little by little and with her charisma, Judith has managed to secure more customers thus improving her profits.  

Judith has a spouse and a son who is her motivation to continue forward.  Thanks to Judith’s efforts she is helping with his education and to improve her house.  With the goal of continuing to grow she is asking for a new loan to invest in her products buying talc, cologne and creams, among other products.  In the future, Judith would like to have a restaurant offering a variety of dishes.

loans.use: to buy creams, talc and perfume.

loans.name: Pakinian Sinthiang Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Pakinian Sinthiang  a été créé le 12 Décembre 2010 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Il compte 40 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.


Madame diabou (accroupie  à l’extrême droit)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, mariée  et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle vend de l’huile de palme, de la patte d’arachide et divers condiments à pakinian Sinthiang et à l’occasion des marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants.


Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de l’huile de palme et de la patte d’arachide  destinés à la revente.



Les bénéfices lui permettront de nourrir sa famille et la prise en charge sanitaire des ces membres.
texts.en:
The group Pakinian Sinthiang was created on December 12, 2010 when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group comprises 40 women who all live in the same village. They all have small businesses. 

Ms. Diabou (crouching at the far right) is the group's official. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She sells palm oil, peanut butter, and various condiments in Pakinian Sinthiang and at weekly markets held in surrounding villages. 

Her new loan will enable her to buy palm oil and peanut butter to resell. The profits will allow her to feed her family and to take care of their health needs.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and peanut butter to resell

loans.name: Anexo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANEXO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pan, venta de polleras, venta de mandiles, zapateria, venta de papa, tejido de chompas, venta de comida

La señora Hilaria  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una socia antigua. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de de tejidos que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de mercadería (compra de lana) que comprará de la Ceja de los puestos de venta y posterior elaborados los productos los distribuirá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The Anexo Community Association will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Centre. The group is composed of nine members with a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Hilaria. They run a variety of businesses: selling bread, selling traditional skirts, selling aprons, shoe seller, potato seller, knitting sweaters, food selling.

Sra. Hilaria says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer; she was invited by a long-term member. Currently she sells knitted items and has had the business for five years.

Hilaria will use the loan to buy more merchandise (wool) and then after making the garments, she will distribute them according to the orders she has received. The work allows her to earn money to support her family. She lives common-law and has three children.

When Hilaria is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
L. Alcancía Comunal”L. Amistad” está conformado por 10 personas unidas y responsables L. cual está formada hace 05 meses donD. L. Sra. Amelia L. presiD.. 
L. Sra. Amelia tiene 57 años D. edad es casada con 06 hijos independientes, anteriormente Amelia trabajaba en un restaurante  como cocinera,  hace 1 años tomo L. decisión D. iniciar su propio negocio así que con L. ayuda D. su esposo y  con el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos pudo iniciar su propio negocio, actualmente se dedica a L. venta D. frituras (salchipapas, hamburguesas, alita broster)  L. cual las venD. todos los días  en las afueras D. su vivienda, trabajo que le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. su hogar. El deseo D. Amelia es D.  instalar una bodega en su casa L. cual pueda ofrecer variedades D. productos. Con el último préstamo piensa invertir en su negocio comprando insumos como papa, pollo, aceite, etc. L. Alcancía Comunal “L. Amistad” agradece L. ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Amistad Community Bank is maD. up of ten united and responsible people. The group was formed five months ago with Sra Amelia as president.

Sra Amelia is 57 years old, married, and has six grown children. In the past she worked as a cook in a restaurant, but a year ago she decided to start her own business. Now she sells fried food (hot dogs, hamburgers etc) which she sells every day outsiD. her home. The money she earns has allowed her to help her husband with household expenses. 

She now wishes to open a grocery store in her home where she can sell a range of products. With this latest loan she is planning to buy items for the store such as potatoes, chicken, oil etc. 

The Amistad Community Bank is grateful for the support that is provided.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, and oil

loans.name: Maurillo Marin

texts.es:
Maurillo Marin tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero vive solo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Maurillo se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra el productor en el local de Agro Insumos María y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar una finca para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre tranquilo, honrado y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Maurillo Marin is 47, single, and lives alone in Chillanes canton in Bolívar province.  The members of the "San Jacinto" communal bank live in San José del Tambo parish, in San Jacinto district, Chillanes canton.  The members of the communal bank work in agriculture, mainly growing corn, cacao, plantain, oranges, and raising livestock. 

Maurillo grows corn, cacao, plantain, oranges, and raises livestock.  He buys his supplies at María Agricultural Supply and sells his products in the market of San José del Tambo every weekend.  

He is applying for the loan to buy manure, seed, agricultural supplies, urea, other types of fertilizers, and pest-control liquids, in order to maintain his crops in good condition.  He will also buy feed for the livestock he raises for later sale at a better price.  The loan will help him meet his financial needs, help him farm better, and improve the quality of his products.  

He faces challenges such as falling prices for the products he sells, and dealing with middlemen. His dream is to be able to buy more land, in order to grow a little more, so as to obtain better earnings for the well-being of his family. He is known for being a quiet man; honest and very responsible, and he makes his payments on time. He likes to go for walks, and likes fiestas; especially Carnival.

loans.use: To buy manure, seed, agricultural supplies, urea, other types of fertilizer, liquids for pest control, and feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Agagul

texts.en:
Agagul is 41, married, and sells groceries from his food store. His vending location is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Agagul knows his customers' preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for more than 10 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. He also has a shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. His total income from both businesses is about 400 USD. Agagul has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history. 

With the first loan, Agagul was able to open this grocery store. He is hoping to invest a loan of 1500 AZN in additional merchandise, which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Agagul has a vision for the expansion of his trade, and we believe it will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys.

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Dolores se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra el productor en el local de Agro Insumos María y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y poder comprar  comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar un terreno para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser tranquila, honrada, responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Dolores Imelda is 44 years old, single, and lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the parish of San José del Tambo in the neighborhood of San Jacinto, which is part of the canton of Chillanes. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture, primarily the cultivation of corn, cacao, bananas, and oranges. They also raise animals.

Dolores grows corn, cacao, bananas, oranges, and raises animals. She buys her inputs from María Agricultural Supplies and sells her products at the market in San José del Tambo every weekend.

Dolores is requesting a loan to buy compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea, and other items to combat pests that attack her crops so that they remain in good condition. She will also buy food for the animals she raises so that she can sell them later at a good price.

This loan will serve as financial support to supply her with what she needs to improve the quality of her crops and her farming activities. She also deals with challenges, such as falling prices for the products she sells, especially the prices offered by brokers. Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can grow a little more, which will generate more profits for the welfare of her family.

Dolores is known for being calm, honest, responsible, and punctual with her payments. She enjoys going out for walks and attending parties, especially during Carnival.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea, and other items for her crops, as well as feed for her animals.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Son 19 mujeres las integrantes de este comité, ellas se unieron con el propósito de seguir creciendo tanto económicamente como en otros aspectos. La razón de unirse es brindar a sus familias todo lo necesario para que tengan una vida digna y decorosa. Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  en las participaciones en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen  cada una de ellas.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de lencerías, comenta que siempre recibe muchos pedidos de sus clientes, esto le genera muy buenos ingresos, con los cuales puede ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Uno de sus sueños es tener una tienda propia donde pueda exhibir todas las prendas que tiene. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y muy responsable.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lencerías, tanto masculina y femenina para la posterior venta. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito,pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Nineteen women make up this communal bank. They joined together with the purpose of continuing to grow not only financially, but in other ways as well. The reason they joined is to be able to provide their families with everything they need to lead dignified and respectable lives. Currently, this group is in its fourth loan cycle, which highlights each woman’s sense of responsibility in participating in activities and meetings, as well as the desire of each of them to make progress.

Señora Maria makes her living by selling lingerie. She comments that she always receives a number of orders from her customers which, in turn, generates a good income that she can use to help her family to get ahead. One of her dreams is to have her own store where she could display all of the garments that she has. She describes herself as a very responsible, hardworking woman and a fighter.

She requests this loan for the purchase of under garments, both masculine and feminine, for resale. She has her hopes set on this loan because getting it will help her a great deal.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie for resale.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios lo conforman Arcadia Gertrudis, Marlin y Coralia del Socorro tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Arcadia, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa (pantalones, blusas, etc.).

Este negocio lo inició hace 30 años como costurera independiente atendiendo pequeños trabajos de confección, ahora recibe pedidos en el mercado y de gente particular los cuales entrega por lo general los días viernes de cada semana. 

Asimismo Marlin es costurera y realiza trabajos de corte y confección y Coralia tiene una venta de refrescos, hielo, helados y otros productos en su casa.
texts.en:
The Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios solidarity group consists of Arcadia Gertrudis, Marlin, and Coralia del Socorro, three hard-working and driven women.

The group coordinator is Arcadia, who makes and sells clothing (pants, blouses, etc.).  She started this business 30 years ago as an independent seamstress taking care of small sewing jobs.  Now she takes orders in the market and from private individuals, which she generally delivers weekly on Friday.

Marlin, also a seamstress, does dressmaking jobs.  Coralia has a business selling soft drinks, ice cream, and other products in her home.

loans.use: to buy primary materials such as cloth, threat, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Chiltoma se encuentra conformado por Nubia Auxiliadora, Maria Elena y Consuelo del Carmen tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas. Este grupo tiene 8 ciclos trabajando con Adim en los cuales han demostrado ser responsables y unos buenos clientes. 
Nubia Auxiliadora de 24 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 5 años y con el crédito comprara  quequisque y chayotes entre otros productos.
Las otras integrantes son María Elena quien vende nacatamales, elotes, yoltamal…etc. y  Consuelo de 60 años quien se dedica al destace de cerdos y la venta ambulante de su carne y derivados. Todas ellas utilizarán el crédito para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The "Chiltoma" solidarity group is composed of Nubia Auxiliadora, Maria Elena and Consuelo del Carmen; three energetic and hard-working women. This group has been working with ADIM for 8 loan cycles, and they have shown themselves to be good, responsible clients. 

Nubia Auxiliadora, 24, is the coordinator of the group. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market for 5 years.  With the loan, she will buy taro root, chayote squash and other products. 

The other members are Maria Elena, who sells nacatamales and yoltamal (both are traditional nicaraguan corncakes), and corn etc. Consuelo is 60.  She  butchers pigs, and sells the meat and by-products in the street. They will all use the loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: To buy taro root and chayote squash

loans.name: Flor Canelitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR CANELITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Producción de lechuga, venta de muebles, venta de comida, cría de ganado, Taller mecánico, producción de leche.
 
La señora Martha,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace diez y siete años, aprendiendo el mismo de un trabajo anterior. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de refrescos) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en una parada de minibuses. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Flor Canelitas" will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Collpani. The group is made up of eight members and it is directed by a board of directors, lead by Martha. The businesses held by the members of the communal bank are varied, and among them we have: lettuce production, furniture sales, food production and sales, livestock farming, mechanic shop, and dairy production.

It is Martha's first time joining Pro Mujer and she joined following an invitation by a promoter. She currently has a food production and sales business. She has had her business for the past sixteen years. She learned the business from previous employment.

The loan that she will access will be used to increase her inventory (to purchase soft drinks) which she will acquire from the commercial district of the city. She will later resell them at a minibus stop. This type of business will help her generate an income to support her family in whatever possible. She is married and she has nine children. 

When she was asked what she appreciates about Pro Mujer she said she enjoys the savings program.

loans.use: to purchase softdrinks.

loans.name: La Pitaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo pitaya lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mayra del Socorro quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales y todos los derivados del cerdo y fritanga…etc. desde hace 8 años. Ella con el crédito comprará cerdo, cebolla, chiltoma…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Martha Nubia quien vende cosméticos y ropa y Rosa María quien vende fritanga, crema, queso y cuajada…etc.
texts.en: The group "Pitaya" is made up of 3 hardworking and enterprising women.  One of these is Mayra del Socorro, who has had a business making nacatamales (a type of tamale typical of the region), dishes made of pork, and fried foods for 8 years.  With this loan she will buy pork, onions, chiltoma peppers, and other items.  The other members of the group are Martha Nubia, who sells cosmetics and clothing, and Rosa Maria, who sells fried foods, cream, cheese, milk curd, and other items.

loans.use: to buy pork, onions, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Victor

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Victor es casado, tiene 38 años de edad, estudios lo estudios de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual está estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio como operador para otro negocio, hasta el momento lleva 16 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, ya que va a compra materia prima para producir más tejido, compra de labor e hilos de diferentes clases y colores, ya que su negocio sea mas prospero en el futuro.
texts.en:
Carlos Victor is 38, married, and has a son who goes to school. He has a primary school education. He is a weaver. 

He started this business as an operator for another business, and now has 16 years of experience.  

He decided to apply for a loan to increase his working capital, as he is going to buy raw material to produce more woven fabric. He is buying labor and thread of different kinds and colors, so that his business will be more prosperous in the future.

loans.use: To buy labor and thread for weaving

loans.name: El Castillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Nelly quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla, yoltamal y cosa de horno desde hace 10 años en Piedra Menuda. Ella es casada y tiene dos niños por los cuales labora arduamente.
María con el crédito comprara materia prima maíz, queso, leña…etc. para seguir aumentando su negocio. 
Las otras integrantes Norma Alicia se dedica a la venta de ropa (pantalones, faldas, camisas…etc.) y Marvely Marisol vende ropa de todo tipo de mujeres, hombre y de niños.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising people.

María Nelly is one of them.  She sells tortillas, yoltamal (Nicaraguan corn tamales), and things from the oven.  She has been doing this for ten years in Piedra Menuda.  She is married, and she has two children for whom she works arduously.

María will use the loan to buy raw materials like corn, cheese, and firewood, etc. in order to continue expanding her business.

Norma Alicia, also a member of the group, sells clothes (pants, skirts, and t-shirts, etc.).

Marvely Marisol, another group member, sells all types of clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro Isabel de 65 años es un hombre trabajador y esforzado quien tiene una panadería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años con esfuerzo propio con 6 quintales diarios de harina ahora realiza entre 10 a 12 quintales de harina de acuerdo a la venta. 
El realiza desde pan de molde, pico, bolillos y galletas su venta mensual es de 20,800 córdobas y su inversión es de 10,000 córdobas. El con el crédito comprara una moto lo que le permitirá regar su producto de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Alejandro Isabel 65, is an energetic, hard-working man who owns a bakery.  

He started his business 15 years ago, through his own efforts. At the beginning, he used 600 lbs. of flour a day, and now he uses between 1000 to 1200 lbs. a day, depending on sales.  He makes loaves, picos (triangular sweet breads), rolls and cookies. His monthly sales are 20,800 cordobas and his investment is 10,000 cordobas. 

With the loan he will buy a motorcycle that will allow him to better distribute his products.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for use in his business.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Jose Manuel es casado, tiene 34 años de edad, estudio los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, inicio este negocio como trabajador para otra empresa, lleva 20 años de experiencia en la venta de  medicina.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería, medicinas de diferentes denominaciones: capsulas, antibióticos, pastillas, ampollas, jarabes, etc. Espera mejorar su negocio con una farmacia surtida y con una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Manuel is married and 34 years old.  He is educated to primary school level, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

He works selling medicine.  He started in this field as an employee for another business, and has 20 years of experience in selling medicine. 

He decided to ask for a loan, which he will use to buy merchandise, medicines of different types: capsules, antibiotics, pills, ampoules, syrups, etc.

He hopes to improve his business through haivng a well-stocked pharmacy and improved quality.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase standard and special-order parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Caramelos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CARAMELOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de alimentos, comercio de ropa, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, ferretería

La señora Virginia, indica que este es tercer año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella pretende iniciar un nuevo negocio (ferretería); ya que anteriormente ella trabajó elaborando masitas por nueve años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de tubos que comprará de la fábrica y lo ubicará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, capacitación y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “CARAMELOS” is starting its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Santiago II group.  The bank is made up of eight members, and is headed up by a board of directors led by Señora Virginia.  The businesses which the members of the Communal Bank are progressing are varied, among them we have: animal sales, clothes retail, food sales, neighborhood store, hardware store.

Señora Virginia says that this is her third year working with Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of her friends.  Right now, she is is intending to start a new business (a hardware store), as previously she worked baking cookies for nine years.

The loan that she is now looking for is for the purchase of tubing, which she will buy from the factory and sell from her store.  This form of work will allow her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the health services, the training and the saving.

loans.use: to buy tubing.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos, 1 de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la panadería, a la elaboración de panes de toda clase, inicio como operario y hasta el momento lleva 30 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Decide hacer un préstamo para invertirlo en capital de trabajo y comprar más insumos para lograr una mayor producción de pan: harina, huevos, leche, azúcar, saborizantes, manteca, levadura. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Señora Micaela is married and is 48 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has six children, one of whom is in school.  She works in a bakery, baking products of every kind.  She started as an operator, and has had 30 years of experience so far.  She has the support of her husband who works doing weaving.

She decided to take out a loan to invest in working capital, and to buy more supplies to be able to achieve improved bread production: flour, eggs, milk, sugar, flavoring, butter, and yeast.

In the future, she wants to see her business be large and productive.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús  de 36 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora propietaria de un pequeño salón de belleza al cual nombro “Alexandra”. Este negocio lo inicio hace 16 años con un espejo, unas cuantas sillas, tijeras, etc. actualmente ha ido mejorando las condiciones, infraestructura y productos que necesita su negocio. Aun hoy está realizando mejorías en su negocio.
Ella invertirá el crédito en permanentes, cremas para alizar, tratamientos para el cabello, mechones, agua oxigenada, tintes…etc.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 36, and a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman. She owns a small beauty salon called “Alexandra's”.  She started this business 16 years ago with a mirror, a few chairs, scissors etc.

Since then, she has been gradually improving the conditions, infrastructure and products needed for her business.

Even today she's carrying out improvements to her business. She will use the loan to buy permanents, straightening creams, hair treatments, highlights, peroxide, tints, etc.

loans.use: To buy products such as permanents, straightening creams, hair treatments, highlights, peroxide, tints etc.

loans.name: Jenoveva

texts.es:
La señora Jenoveva es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 25 años se dedica a la docencia en Diriomo. Ella está casada y tiene dos niños de edad escolar los cuales son su motivación.
Jenoveva con el crédito realizara reparaciones en su vivienda principalmente el techo ya que es necesario ya que tiene muchas goteras y está deteriorado.
texts.en:
Señora Jenoveva is an enterprising woman, who has been a teacher in Diriomo for the last 25 years.  She is married, and has two school-age children who are her motivation.

Jenoveva will use the loan to make repairs to her home, mainly to the roof which needs it as it has many leaks and is in a deteriorated condition.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home, mainly to the roof.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 51 años es una mujer trabajadora, convive desde hace un tiempo con Dionisio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos mayores y realizados. Ahora ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista – Huaracayo. Los días de está valiente mujer se centran en el trabajo arduo. Hace 33 años comenzó su camino por la agricultura. En todo ese tiempo logró adquirir, gracias a su esfuerzo, sus propios terrenos agrícolas, su pequeña casa y sacar a sus hijos adelante, los que según cuenta; le ayudan en mantener sus sembríos de papa, alverja y demás hortalizas en buen estado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo con su familia. “A pesar de no vivir con mis hijos mayores, siempre nos ayudamos. Ellos también son agricultores”, afirma muy alegre Justina. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo, por lo que comenzó a incorporarse con el banco comunal de su zona, donde está segura; podrá lograr su objetivo de sembrar en mayor cantidad. Ahora ella desea incursionar en la siembra de maíz y alverja, donde espera obtener nuevas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal, “Señor de Muruhuay” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Justina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de alverja que hace poco sembró.
texts.en:
Justina, aged 51, is a hard-working woman.  She has lived with her husband Dionisio for some time, and they have four grown children together.  Now they live in their own home, located in the hamlet of Bellavista – Huaracayo.

The days of this valiant woman are centered on hard work.  33 years ago, she began her path in agriculture.  Over this time, she has managed to acquire, thanks to her effort, her own farmlands, her small house, and to move her children ahead in life. According to her, her children help her maintain her crops of potatoes, peas and other vegetables in good order.

What she likes most about her work is being able to spend most of her time with her family.  "Even though I don't live with my grown children, we always help each other out.  They are also farmers", says Justina, very happily.

Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital, which is why she started to work with the communal bank in her area.  She is sure that with this, she will be able to achieve her goal of increasing crop quantity.  She now wants to move into growing corn and peas, from which she will obtain new earnings.  

She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” Communal Bank, and this is her first loan through MFP, from whom she is hoping for a small loan to achieve her goals.  She also promises to be punctual with her repayments.

On receiving your help, Justina will invest the requested money in purchasing several bags of natural fertilizers to spread on the pea crops, which have shown little growth.

loans.use: to buy several bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es maestra desde hace 18 años y vende productos Avon y Zermat. Ella tiene tres hijos de 13, 10 y 8 años de edad respectivamente los cuales son su mayor motivación.
Martha con el crédito realizara reparaciones es su hogar ya que es necesario el cambio de techo y ventanas principalmente.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Lorena is a hard-working and enterprising woman, who has been a teacher for the last 18 years, and also sells Avon and Zermat products.  She has three children, aged 13, 10 and 8 years old respectively; these are her major motivation in life.

Martha is going to use the loan to make repairs to her home, mainly as the roof and windows need replacing.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home's roof and windows.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises, de 34 años, un hombre bueno y alegre; está casado con Julia. Ambos tienen dos hijos, Hildebrant y Anali , con los cuales vive en una casa alquila, ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. El trabajo primordial de él, se centra en el arado diario de diferentes terrenos de cultivo. Los que realiza gracias al toro que adquirió, hace algunos años, y que gracias a su escasa competencia, le genera muchas ganancias. Pero la actividad que más le gusta, es la agricultura, ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello, sus principales productos se centran en la siembra de papa, arveja y cebada; las que cuida con mucha dedicación y ahínco. En cada campaña agrícola, el apoyo de su banco comunal es muy importante, ya que cada día tiene una producción de calidad. Ahora que no hay lluvias y sus terrenos no son productivos, está trabajando como seguridad en una empresa importante en la ciudad de Oroya, donde espera tranquilo la temporada de sembrío. Por ello más adelante desea sembrar en mayores cantidades, para abastecer la demanda que generar sus productos en esa época. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde asegura que cada cosecha, gracias a su banco comunal le genera mayores ganancias. Además agradece al apoyo de todos los que hacen posible el crédito. Ulises de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de papa y avena.
texts.en:
Ulises, aged 34, is a good and happy man.  He is married to Julia, and they have two children together: Hildebrant and Anali.  He lives with them in a rented house, located in the Huaricolca area.  

His main work is the daily plowing of different farmlands.  He does this thanks to a bull he acquired several years ago, and given there is scarce competition, he earns good income.  However, the work he most enjoys is farming.  He has spent five years farming; his principal products are growing potatoes, peas and barley, which he tends to with much dedication and effort.  The help of the communal bank is very important to each of his agricultural efforts, as he need to maintain a quality production on a daily basis.  Currently there has been no rain, and his farmlands are not productive.  For security, he has been working for an important company in the city of Oroya, where he is calmly waiting for the growing season.

Looking forward, he wants to grow bigger quantities, in order to meet the demand that his products generate in season.

He belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza"  ("New Hope") communal banks, and this is his fourth loan through MFP.  This will assure that each harvest will generate more income, thanks to the communal bank.  He is also grateful for the support of everyone who has made this loan possible.  

On receiving your support, Ulises will invest the requested money in purchasing natural fertilizers for his next planting of potatoes and oats.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia, es una mujer luchadora D. 56 años. Hace 20 años que enviudo. Ella tiene 7 hijos y una economía estable, pero ahora solo vive con su hija Karina, “madre soltera”, a quien apoya en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad D.  Huancal - Huaricolca.  
Su vitalidad y coraje lo demuestra en sus logros obtenidos. El orgullo que tiene por su última hija; Mily, D. 25 años, que terminó la carrera D. enfermería y así como ella 2 D. sus hermanos son profesionales. A pesar D. sus limitaciones pudo pagar los estudios universitarios D. sus hijos. Todo esto gracias a la siembra D. papa, olluco, cebada y avena, que le proporcionaron buenas utilidades. En la actualidad sus cosechas, son muy cotizadas en el mercado central D. la ciudad y, como mujer luchadora, en campañas agrícolas viaja a las ciudades D. Lima, Chanchamayo y Masamari a ofrecer tubérculos al por mayor y verduras al menudeo. Pero consiente que las campañas agrícolas no duran todo el año, muy hábil ella tiene varias cabezas D. ganado ovino y vacuno que le ayudan en solventar algunos gastos. Para más adelante está planeando, ampliar su negocio D. ganadería con la mejora D. su granja D. animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el décimo tercer préstamo con MFP, donD. es reconocida en su banco comunal, como una persona responsable; por ello ocupa un cargo importante dentro D. su grupo. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Rosalia está pensando sembrar 50 sacos D. semilla D. papa “yungay, única y canchan”, por ello D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra. Asimismo el pago D. los peones que le ayudarán en la jornada.
texts.en:
Rosalia, 56, is a hard-working woman. She has been a widow for 20 years. She has seven children and her economic situation is stable, but she now lives in her own home with her daughter Karina, a single mother, whom she helps. They live in the Huancal - Huaricolca town.
Her vitality and and courage are demonstrated in her successes. She is proud of her oldest daughter, Mily, age 25, who just finished nursing school; like Mily, two of her brothers are professionals. Despite her limitations, Rosalia was able to pay for her children's university studies. All of this is thanks to her crops of potato, ulluco, barley and oats, which bring her a good income. Currently her harvests are very sought-after in the city's central market. And, as the hard-working woman that she is, during agricultural seasons she travels to the cities of Lima, Chanchamayo and Masamari to sell her tubers wholesale, and to sell vegetables at retail prices. However, the agricultural seasons do not last all year, so this bright woman has several heads of ovine and bovine livestock which helps her to cover some costs. For the future, she is planning to expand her livestock business through improving her animal farm. She belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] Communal Bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. In MFP she is known in her communal bank as a responsible person, and because of this she occupies an important position in the group. She promises to be punctual with her quotas. Rosalia plans to purchase 50 bags of potato seeds of the Yungay, Unica and Canchan variety. Upon receiving your support, she will invest the requested loan in the purchase of various bags of natural fertilizers to start her new planting with success. She will also pay the labourers who help her during the day.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and to hire labourers.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Lucia   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicios
 
La señora Lucia indica que es el segundo año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de movilidad, que viene trabajando hace diez y siete años atrás.
