El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de unos repuestos de movilidad) que compra de la distribuidora y posterior lo comercializará en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene siete hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.

En la fotografía no aparese la sseñora Carmen, ya que se fue a consulta médica
texts.en:
The “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” Communal Bank is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Regional Office. It has eight members and is directed by a board of directors headed by Señora  Lucia. The members' businesses are varied and include: trade, production, and services.

Señora Lucia says that this is her second year in a Pro Mujer communal bank. She joined at the invitation of a promoter. She currently has a business  dealing with spare parts for vehicles. She has had this business for seventeen years.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her merchandise (with the purchase of vehicle spare parts) which she purchases from a distributor and then sells in her stall. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family where possible, as she is in a common-law marriage and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes everything.

Señora Carmen is not in the photo, as she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es: Adelia, de 44 años, es una mujer con muchas ambiciones, hace 21 años que convive con Cancio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos; en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. Ver a sus hijos profesionales y encaminarlos en la vida, es su meta. Por ello, hace 21 años que trabaja con ahínco en la siembra de papa, arveja y avena; que gracias a los constantes cuidados; le genera buenas ganancias. Pero conciente, que en temporadas donde hay  escasez de agua, no se puede sembrar; ella aprovecha para vender la leche que produce su 2 vacas de la raza “mantona”; con ello, asegura la estabilidad económica de su familia. Además de varias cabezas de ganado ovino, que también comercializa después de ensebarlos. Como buena madre siempre vela por la alimentación de sus hijos. Ella también cría animales menores como: cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, que según cuenta utiliza la carne para su alimentación, pero viendo su buena crianza está planeando comercializarlos y abrir una estancia de ganados a todo nivel. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde augura muchos éxitos a su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y solidarias. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Adelia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 15 sacos de fertilizantes naturales y 20 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “tomaza”, que muy pronto sembrará.
texts.en:
Adelia, age 44, is a woman of many ambitions. She has lived with Cancio, her husband, for 21 years. Together they have 6 children, but only 5 live with them. They have their own home in the town of Huaricolca. Their goal is to see their children become professionals and to set them off in the right direction. With this in mind, they have worked diligently for 21 years sowing potatoes, peas, and oats. Thanks to their constant care, this generates them a good income. However, during water shortages they are unable to sow. Adelia takes advantage of this time to sell the milk that their two Mantona cows produce. In doing this, she ensures her family's economic stability. In addition, they have several heads of sheep, which they sell after fattening them.

A good mother, Adelia is always thinking about putting food on her children's table. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and hogs, whose meat they eat. However, she sees that they grow well and she plans to sell them and to open a ranch for all kinds of livestock. 

She belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] Communal Bank, and this is her second loan with MFP. She predicts great success with this communal bank, as they are responsible and united people. For this reason, Adelia promises to be punctual with the payment of her quotas. Upon receiving your support, Adelia will invest the requested loan in the purchase of 15 bags of natural fertilizers and 20 bags of potato seed of the Tomaza variety, which she will sow very soon.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of fertilizers and 20 bags of potato seeds.

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvia del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 54 años. Ella inicio con un tramo en el mercado donde trabajo alrededor de 30 años actualmente por el cansancio y su edad vendió ese negocio y puso una pequeña pulpería la cual tiene bien surtida.
Ella es viuda y sus cuatro hijos son mayores de los cuales una de sus hijas es la que le ayuda en el negocio y su meta es que su pulpería llegue hacer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Silvia del Carmen is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is 54 years old.  She began with a spot at the market where she worked for about 30 years; now, as a result of fatigue and age, she has sold this business and started a small convenience store which she keeps well stocked.

She is a widow and her four children are grown; one of her daughters helps her with the business.   Her goal for her convenience store is to start selling bulk goods.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her convenience store, especially bulk grains.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: La señora Griselda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la elaboración de bordados y ropa típica la cual comercializa en Rivas desde hace varios años. Ella tiene un pequeño taller cuenta con seis trabajadores y con el crédito comprará materia prima tela, hilo, lana…etc.
texts.en:
Griselda is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She does embroidery and makes traditional clothing, which she has been selling in Rivas for several years.  

She has a small workshop with 6 workers, and will use the loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, wool etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, wool etc.

loans.name: Buenísimos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Buenísimos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas Rosa Esmeralda quien vende cosechas de frutas y verduras desde hace 30 años. Ella en este negocio invierte alrededor de 11, 000 córdobas mensuales y vende 18,800 córdobas mensuales. 
Ella con el crédito compra mayor cantidad de cosechas de frutas y verduras de temporada.
Las otras integrantes son Julia quien vende enchiladas, platanitos, arroz con leche y torta de leche…etc. y Erick vende ropa (pantalones, blusas, chores)
texts.en:
The "Buenísimos"groups is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Rosa Esmeralda, who has been selling fresh fruit and vegetables for the last 30 years.  She invests about 11,000 córdobas monthly into her business, and sells about 18,800 córdobas worth monthly.

With the loan, she is going to buy a large amount of seasonal fresh fruit and vegetables.

The other members are Julia who sells enchiladas, plantains, rice pudding, milk pudding, etc., and Erick, who sells clothes (trousers, blouses, shorts).

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Genesis Noelia

texts.es: La Sra. Génesis es soltera, no tiene hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, etc.) con esfuerzo y ahorro pudo aperturar su tienda; ya lleva en el negocio más de 2 años. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes para surtir más su tienda y una congeladora; su principal sueño es terminar de construir su casa y tener una gran tienda. La Sra. Génesis está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Génesis is single and has no children.  She sells groceries (sugar, rice, oil, beans, etc.).  With effort and savings she was able to open her store, and has been in business for over 2 years.  She will invest the loan in buying groceries to stock her store and a freezer.  Her main dream is to finish building her house and have a great store.  Génesis is very appreciative of the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy groceries and a freezer.

loans.name: Hector Moises

texts.es:
El señor Hector Moises es casado, tiene 32 años de edad, estudio los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, al tejido de ropa típica y servilletas, inicio este negocio como operario y hasta el momento lleva 16 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para compra de materia prima, labor e hilos de diferentes clases y colores, y así aumentar su producción ya que en el futuro espera  tener su negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Señor Hector Moises is married and 32 years old.  He studied through primary-level education, and has three children, two of whom attend school.

His work is weaving; he weaves traditional clothes and napkins.  He began this business as a worker, and so far has 16 years of experience.

He decided to ask for a loan which he will use to buy raw materials, labor, and yarns of different thicknesses and colors.  In this way he will increase his production, as in the future he hopes to have his business grow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, labor, and yarns of different thicknesses and colors.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela Maria tiene 39 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de prodcutos. Angela es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, que cuentan con educación secundaria. Este financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, enlatados, papel higiénico, detergentes otros productos. Todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para empezar a brindarle a sus clientes lo que le solicitan. Ella se siente feliz por tener algo que le genere ganancias.
texts.en: Ángela Maria is 39 years old, and she has a local store. She's had this store for more than 6 months. The majority of her clients request a large varieties of products. She is a single mother and has 3 children, with a secondary education. This loan is to buy grains, candy, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent, and other products. Every day she has to get up early to give her customers what they ask for. She's happy to have something that gives her income.

loans.use: to buy grain, candy, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent, and other products.

loans.name: Silvia Fabiola

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es socia del banco comunal Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es policía.
Hace poco que trabaja con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de ropas y sandalias y lo hace de forma ambulatoria, sus dos hijos todavía son pequeños y tiene también que atenderlos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 ½ de sandalias, 6 polos, 6 blusas, 6 shores, 3 vestidos, 2 docenas de ropas interiores.
Con su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo, porque el sueldo que tiene no es mucho y apenas les alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas del hogar.
Más adelante espera contar  con una pequeña tienda de ropas y no tener que estar de un lado a otro, espera que Manuela Ramos le siga apoyando en su proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia is a member of the "Las Colinas" communal bank, in the Yarinacocha District in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 35 years old and married with two children.  Her husband is a policeman.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for a short time.  She works selling clothes and sandals, which she does as a street vendor.  Her two children are still young, and she still needs to look after them.

With this new loan of 1,700 New Soles, she will buy: 1.5 units of sandals, 6 units of polo shirts, 6 units of blouses, 6 units of shorts,and 2 dozen sets of underwear.

With her work, she is able to help her husband out, because the salary he earns isn't much, and barely stretches to cover their basic household needs.

She hopes later on to have a small clothing store, and not to have to go from one place to another.  She hopes that Manuela Ramos will continue to support her in her life goal.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 58 años quien tiene una comideria. Ella inicio con la venta de gomas luego inicio a vender desayunos y hace poco comida. Ella con el crédito comprar sillas para el negocio, materiales  y otra parte para su uso personal.
texts.en: Sonia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She started out selling gum and later began selling breakfasts and she makes food. With the loan, she is going to buy chairs and materials for her business, and the rest is for personal use.

loans.use: To buy chairs and materials for her business and the rest is for personal use.

loans.name: Maria Paciona

texts.es:
La Sra. María Paciona pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Convivente, tiene 42  años y 9 hijos, sólo 2 están en edad escolar y están a su cargo.
María es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace 3 años trabajaba vendiendo asados y parrillas (comida típica) en las afueras de su casa, por motivos de salud dejó ésta actividad; y por iniciativa propia decide, con un inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles dedicarse a la venta de golosinas como: galletas chocolates, chiclets, caramelos y otros; le va muy bien en sus ventas ya que las  realiza en los diferentes lugares de la ciudad, cuenta con clientes fijos y público en general. Este negocio le da muy buenas ganancias y le brinda muchas satisfacciones y mucha tranquilidad.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará paquetes de galletas, cajas de caramelos de diferentes sabores, cajas de chocolates, cajas de chupetines, cajas de chiclets y otros.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa y contar con un negocio de venta de abarrotes (artículos de primera necesidad), está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Paciona belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is lives with a partner, is 42 years old, and has 9 children, of which only two are school age and in her care. 

Maria is an enterprising woman. For 3 years she had worked selling "asados" and "parrillas" (local cuisine) outside of her house. For health reasons she ended this business, and through her own initiative she decided, with start-up money of S/.300.00 nuevos soles, to sell candy like: chocolate cookies, gum, caramels, and other items. Things are going very well with her sales which she makes in different parts of the city, selling to regular customers and the general public. This business brings good income and provides her with much satisfaction and contentment. 

With this loan of S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy packages of cookies and cases of different flavored candies, chocolate, lollipops, gum, and other items. 

Her dream is to have her own house and business selling groceries (necessary items). She is very thankful for the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her succeed.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, chocolate, lollipops, gum, and other items.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: La Sra. Juana  es casada, tiene 4 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” grupo  conformado por 7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Juana  trabaja desde hace  15 años en la venta de prendas de vestir ( polos, pantalones, camisa, blusas) este negocio surge porque Juana tenia 4 hijos y el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos , alimentación, educación y pagos de servicios,  es así que Juana empezó vendiendo ropa a  domicilio y con el tiempo puso  una tienda de ropa,  Juana nos cuenta que nada fue fácil trabajo muy duro para obtener lo hoy en día tiene  ,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos fueron a la escuela, ha construido su casa, y su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería(polos, pantalones, camisa, blusas), Sabemos que Juana  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Juana  is married and has 4 children. She is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank made up of 7 members who work in diverse activities as merchants. For 15 years, Juana has worked selling clothing (t-shirts, pants, shirts, and blouses). She started the business because Juana has 4 children and her husband's salary wasn't enough to cover basic expenses such as food, schooling, and utilities. That's why Juana started selling clothes door to door and after a while she opened a store. Juana tells us that it wasn't easy getting what she has today. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has been able to have better income. Her children have gone to school, she built a house and her family has a better quality of life. In order to keep growing, she has asked for a new loan to buy merchandise (t-shirts, pants, shirts and blouses). We know that Juana will meet her goals with a lot of work and dedication and the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (pants, blouses and t-shirts).

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Fue hace 5 años que la Sra. Ofelia empezó el  sueño del negocio propio ella se inicio viajando a la ciudad D. Trujillo ubicado al norte del Perú donD. el calzado es bueno y barato, ella compraba los zapatos a bajo costo y  los vendía en la ciudad donD. el precio es mas elevado esto le permitía tener mas ganancias fue así que  su negocio fue creciendo y  pudo juntar algo D. dinero para comprarse un puesto D. venta en una galería D. su sector, donD. actualmente tiene su boutique que tiene por nombre “DETALLES” ahora no solo venD. zapatos sino toda clase D. productos como ropas y accesoR. para mujer, su negocio es completo D. manera que sus ingresos le permiten ayudar  a sus hijos en los estudios algo que para la Sra. Ofelia es elemental ya que desea que sus hijos sean profesionales ellos  también ayudan atendiendo en el negocio  , el dinero D. su préstamo lo usara para seguir invirtiendo e su tienda comprara  regalos , ropa y accesoR. para ofrecer a su clientela, el grupo al cual pertenece se llama “TODO LO PUEDO EN CRISTO” son 07 socias amigas y vecinas del mismo lugar.

   * La Sra Ofelia es la cuarta D. la derecha viste chompa color crema.
texts.en:
Five years ago, Sra. Ofelia began her dream of having her own business. She started traveling to the city of Trujillo in northern Peru, where the shoes are cheap and of good quality. By purchasing shoes at low cost, Ofelia was able to sell them in her city at a higher price. This allowed her to generate more income. As a result, her business grew and she was able to use some of her money to buy a vending space at a shopping center in her neighborhood where she currently has a boutique called “Details”. Not only does she sell shoes, but Ofelia also offers all types of products such as clothing and women’s accessories. Her business is complete and helps her to generate revenue so that she can help her children with their studies. This is important to Ofelia because she wants them to become professionals. Her children also help with managing her business.

The money from her loan will be used to continue investing in her store. She plans to buy gifts, clothing, and accessories to offer to her customers. The group that she belongs to is called “Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo” (I Can Do All Things Through Christ), which consists of seven members who are friends and neighbors from the same area.

*Sra. Ofelia is standing fourth from the right, wearing a cream-colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy gifts, clothing, and accessories.

loans.name: Otilda Marta

texts.es:
La señora Otilda Marta es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 9 hijos 8 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al tricotado y tejidos de hilo, inicio como empleada para otro negocio, hasta el momento lleva 30 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilo de diferentes clase y colores, para tener mas producción de tenido y mejorar su condición de vida, ya que en el futuro espera tener un negocio amplio y mejor.
texts.en:
Sra. Otilda Marta is 48 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to study. She has nine children, eight of whom are in school. Otilda knits and weaves articles out of yarn. She started out as an employee of another business. To date, she has accumulated 30 years of experience.

Otilda decided to request a loan so that she could purchase yarn of different types and colors so that she could increase production and improve her living conditions. In the future, she hopes to have a larger and better business.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for knitting and weaving.

loans.name: Gladys Marina

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de chanchos,  ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales en bordados, aunque su actividad principal es la venta de muebles, trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. 
Con su nuevo préstamo solicitado de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su carpintería, comprará maderas para la fabricación de muebles como mesas, camas, roperos, sillas.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es construir su casa, mejorarla y tener un carro para uso personal.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad, las charlas y el ahorro.

En la foto la vemos con uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Gladys has a high school education.

Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN, which was invested in her business of selling pigs. Gladys now sells handmade embroidered articles. However, her main business activity is selling furniture. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN that she is requesting, Gladys will invest the money in her carpentry shop. She will buy wood for making furniture such as tables, beds, wardrobes, and chairs. Gladys and her husband work together in this business.

Her dream is to build a house, make improvements, and buy a car for personal use. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the punctuality, the responsibility, the discussions, and the savings.

In the photo, Gladys appears with one of her children.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Ella tiene educación superior.
El primer préstamo recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos fue por S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales.  Trabaja hace un año con esta institución.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco kilos de lana con matiz y también comprará artesanía en bordados para venderlos.  Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como profesor.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así generar más ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Amalia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Amalia received her higher education.

The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling handicrafts. She has worked with the organization for one year.

With this new loan of 800 PEN, Amalia will buy five kilos of dyed wool. She will also buy embroidered handicrafts to sell. Her husband works as a teacher.

Amalia’s dream is to improve her business and generate more income. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the savings.

loans.use: to buy five kilos of dyed wool and embroidered handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, de 52 años, es una mujer optimista, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos; Nataly y Ángel con los que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todos los días, desde las primeras horas, sale a pastar a los animales que comercializa; ya que es su principal actividad comercial. Ella posee, 3 toros, 7 vacas,  varias cabezas de ovejas y 3 novillos pequeños que gracias a los cuidados que le brinda a diario podrán crecer fuertes y saludables. Según cuenta le va muy bien pues ella misma siembra el pasto que comen sus animales. Está muy contenta, ya que ahora 3 de sus vacas están apareadas. Cuando sus animales están aptos para ser comercializados, los ofrece en el camal de su localidad. Sin embargo Sabina cuenta, que en temporadas de invierno, cuando las vacas poseen más leche, ella aprovecha y elabora queso, el cual comercializa juntamente a la leche sobrante. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de papa en todas sus variedades, pero esta actividad solo lo realiza una vez al año. Para más adelante, desea apoyar en su hija Nataly en la especialización de su oficio de cosmetóloga. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde todo este tiempo que integra su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha de apoyar en el surgimiento de sus socias. Además agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes, por ello promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Sabina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “única” y “tomaza”, además de fertilizantes naturales y semilla de avena para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 52, is an optimistic woman and a single mother of two children, Nataly and Ángel. She and her family live in their own home in the rural district of Huaricolca. Every day during the first few hours, she lets out her animals to graze. Selling these animals is her main business activity. Sabina owns three bulls, seven cows, several heads of sheep, and three small heifers. Thanks to the care she provides, her animals are able to grow to be strong and healthy. According to Sabina, she has been just as successful in growing fodder to feed to her animals. She is pleased now that three of her cows have been impregnated. When her animals are fit to be sold, they are offered to the local slaughterhouse. During the winter season when the cows produce more milk, Sabina says she takes advantage of this time to make cheese, which she sells along with any remaining milk. In addition, she plants potatoes of all varieties but she only does this once a year. Going forward, she wants to support her daughter Nataly as she pursues a career in cosmetology.

Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is her fifth loan with MFP. Every time she is with her group, she can feel the support emerging from all of the other members. In addition, she is grateful for everyone’s support so she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the support she will receive, Sabina plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of three sacks of potato seeds of the “Única” and “Tomaza” varieties. She will also buy natural fertilizers and oat seeds for the next planting.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of potato seeds, fertilizers, and oat seeds.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, de 41 años, es una mujer fuerte y trabajadora, convive con Luis, su esposo, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores, a los que cuida y educa en una casa alquilada en la comunidad de Huaricolca. Con la seguridad, que le caracteriza, afirma, que lo importante en la agricultura es comercializar en diferentes lugares. Por ello quiso adquirir un camión, con el que pueda trasladar su producción y así lo realizó, gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, ahora no solo traslada su siembra, también hace servicio de carga a diferentes lugares del país; donde gana un dinero extra. Ya tiene 18 años de experiencia y su buena cosecha de papa, en sus diferentes variedades, como: “tomaza” (que vende mayormente como semillas), “Color” (el cual comercializa en la ciudad de Oroya, donde tiene buenos clientes); le brindan buenos ingresos y utilidades. Pero la ganadería, es otra de las actividades de Adelaida, ella tiene varias cabezas de ganado ovino; el cual enseba y comercializa en el mercado mayorista, gracias a los buenos pastos que ella misma siembra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de poder tener capital, el cual le permite ahorrar. Por ello agradece a todos ustedes, ya que le abrieron las puertas al desarrollo. Adelaida piensa sembrar 15 sacos de semilla de papa “única” y “tomaza”; por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales que le permitan concretar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Adelaida, age 41, is a strong and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Luis and they have four young children, who they care for and provide an education. Adelaida and her family live in a rented house in the community of Huaricolca. With the confidence that she is known for, Adelaida says that it is important to sell her agricultural products in different places. For this reason, she wants to acquire a truck for transporting her crops. She will also be able to provide cargo services to different parts of the country as a way of earning extra money. Adelaida has 18 years of experience harvesting potatoes of different varieties, such as “Tomaza” (sold primarily for its seeds) and “Color” (which is sold in the city of Oroya where she has good customers). Her crops generate good revenues and profits. Raising livestock is Adelaida’s other business activity. She has several heads of sheep that will be fattened and sold at the wholesale market. Adelaida also grows the fodder that is fed to her animals.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is her eighth loan with MFP. Adelaida is very pleased to have capital because she will be able to save. For this reason, she expresses her appreciation to everyone for opening the doors to development. She plans to plant 15 sacks of potato seeds of the “Única” and “Tomaza” varieties. With the support she received, Adelaida will invest the money she requested in several sacks of natural fertilizers so that she can guarantee success with her next planting.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 66 años, es un hombre “singular”, él vive junto a sus inquilinos en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca, los cuales son su única compañía. Hace ya algunos años que se jubiló, pero a pesar de ello afirma “que el sentido de su vida es el campo y, poder producirlo”. Ya tiene, 9 años dedicándose a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente para poder aprender a trabajarla y comercializar a un buen precio. Sus cultivos de papa y avena, son muy productivos, y en campañas agrícolas suele viajar a la ciudad de Tarma, donde gracias a su buen juicio en las ventas, puede terminar en menor tiempo todos sus sacos de papa. Afirma que solo cosecha una vez al año, pues sus terrenos agrícolas son temporales (necesitan de épocas de lluvia para producir). Además de tener una casa grande y equipada donde alquila cuartos, ahora tiene 7 lugares con inquilinos que le deja un dinero extra. Él siente que ya no tienen la fuerza de antes; por ello esta ahorrando un monto considerable de dinero, con el que comprará una casa en la ciudad y de esa manera poder cuidar de su salud. Además está pensando incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de tubérculos, donde será comerciante mayorista. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, donde es fiscal de su banco comunal, está muy contento de poder ayudar a sus integrantes a salir adelante junto con ellos. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Marcelo está pensando sembrar papa de la variedad “yungay”, ya tiene 20 sacos de semilla que muy pronto cosechará; por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 66 years old and a single man who lives in his own home in the rural district of Huaricolca. He resides alongside his tenants since they are his only form of company. Despite being retired for several years, Marcelo says, “My meaning in life comes from farming and being able to produce.” He has been farming for nine years, which is a sufficient amount of time to learn how to work and sell at a good price. His crops of potatoes and oats are very productive, so he frequently travels to the city of Tarma during the farming season. As a result of his good judgment when selling, Marcelo has been able to sell all of his sacks of potatoes. He says that he only harvests once a year because the production is seasonal (the rainy seasons must occur in order for the land to be productive). Marcelo has a large house that is equipped with rental rooms. Now he has seven rooms that are occupied with tenants, which allows him to generate extra money. He feels that he does not put forth as much effort as before. For this reason, he is saving a considerable amount of money so that he can buy a house in the city, which will help him to take care of his health. Marcelo also plans to venture into the business of buying and selling tubers as a wholesaler.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” and this is his tenth loan with MFP. Marcelo is the treasurer of his Communal Bank and is very happy to help the other members move forward together as a group. For this reason, he promises to be punctual with his payments. Marcelo plans to grow potatoes of the “Yungay” variety and has 20 sacks worth of seed potatoes that will be harvested very soon. With the support he received, Marcelo will invest the money he requested in several sacks of natural fertilizers so that he can successfully start his next planting.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 47 años, es un padre ejemplar, junto a su esposa Betty, salen adelante para poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus 3 hijos, quienes viven en la ciudad para poder tener una buena educación. Ellos viven solos en su casa propia, ubicado en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Como socios, ellos se distribuyen las diversas actividades económicas que realizan. Betty cuida de su pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde todos los días ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Mientras Moisés, se dedica al servicio de trasporte, en la ruta Tarma-Huaricolca. Pero la actividad que más los une a ellos es la agricultura, ahí todos los fines de semana, cuidan de sus cultivos de papa, avena y olluco (productos agrícolas) que siembran en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos productivos y otras tantas que alquila en temporadas, ya tienen 21 años dedicándose a ello y juntos hacen posible mandar el dinero necesario a la capital del país, donde estudian sus hijos. Por ello para el futuro desea, comprar una casa en la capital, donde planean poner una tienda de comestibles y alquilar cuartos, con ello estarán cerca de sus hijos y podrán verlos desarrollarse para el futuro. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde los integrantes son personas unidas y muy solidarias. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Moisés está pensando sembrar papa de la variedad “única y tomaza”, por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 30 sacos de fertilizante orgánico y 50 sacos de guano de isla, que le ayudará en su próximo sembrío de papa.
texts.en:
Moisés is 47 years old and an exemplary father. He and his wife Betty are able to move forward so that they can offer a good education for their three children. Their children live in the city so that they can pursue a good education. Moisés and his wife live alone in their own home in the rural district of Huaricolca. As residents of this area, they divide their time among different business activities. Betty manages a small grocery store where she offers basic necessity products every day. Meanwhile, Moisés provides transportation services and has a route that runs from Tarma to Huaricolca. However, the business activity that unites them is farming. Every weekend they look after their crops of potatoes, oats, and “ulluco” that are grown on two hectares of productive farmland. They rent additional land on a seasonal basis. Moisés and his wife have been farming for 21 years and this has enabled them to send money to Lima, where their children are studying. In the future, he wants to buy a house in Lima where he plans to open a grocery store and build rental rooms so that he can be near his children and see them develop.

Moisés is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is his sixth loan with MFP. He is pleased to be a member of the Communal Bank because the members are close and supportive of one another. For this reason, he promises to submit his payments on time. Moisés is planning to plant potatoes of the “Única” and “Tomaza” varieties, which is why he is receiving this loan. The money he requested will be used to buy 30 sacks of organic fertilizer and 50 sacks of guano manure, which will be helpful with his next crop of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy to buy 30 sacks of organic fertilizer and 50 sacks of guano manure.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 42 años, es una mujer responsable junto a su esposo, Gregorio. Trabajan con perseverancia, para sacar adelante a sus 3 pequeños hijos, a los que cuidan y educan con mucho amor en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día, Gregorio, realizar trasporte público, en la ruta Tarma – Huaricolca; mientras que Lida, atiende a su clientes que constantemente visitan su tienda de comestibles, donde no solo vende productos de primera necesidad; también “leña” (que utilizan, para cocinar los alimentos), producto que tienen buena demanda en la zona. Y ambos, todos los fines de semana, como hace 11 años, se dedican todo el día al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembran papa y avena; los que después de cosecharlos los comercializan en el mercado central de la ciudad. Para más adelante tienen planeado comprar una casa en el centro de la ciudad, ahí desean expandir su negocio de comestibles, como también abrir su granja de cuyes más implementada, pues le está generando buenas ganancias y desea invertir más en ello. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde sus integrantes son personas muy responsables. Razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Lida de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío de avena y papa de la variedad “yungay” y “canchan”.
texts.en:
Lida is 42 years old and a responsible woman. She and her husband Gregorio have worked with perseverance to get ahead on behalf of their three young children, for whom they provide an education and take care of with much love. Lida and her family live in their own home in the rural district of Huaricolca. Every morning during the first few hours of the day, her husband Gregoria begins providing transportation services along the route from Tarma to Huaricolca. Meanwhile, Lida attends to her customers who constantly visit her grocery store. Not only does she sell basic necessity products, but also firewood for cooking since this product is high demand in the area. Every weekend for the past 11 years, both Lida and her husband have spent the entire day looking after their farmland on which they grow potatoes and oats. After these crops are harvested, they sell them at the central market in the city. Going forward, they plan to buy a house in the central part of the city so that they can expand their grocery business. They also want to start a well-managed guinea pig farm to generate more income, so they plan to invest more.

Lida is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is her third loan with MFP. She is very pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because all of its members are responsible individuals. For this reason, she promises to submit her payments on time. With the support she will receive, Lida plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her next planting of oats and potatoes of the “Yungay” and “Canchan” varieties.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and to pay for repairs to her husband's motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and household products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her stand and buy more chickens.

loans.name: Theurn

texts.en: Theurn is a 31-year-old woman living with her old mother, age 70, located in Prey Chor District, Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. The principal local economic activities in this province are livestock raising (cow, cattle) and agriculture. Presently, she generates her profit by doing farming. From this business, she earns a low income per month. To assist her to increase her income, Theurn would like to purchase a cow to raise but lacks money. That's why she decided to request some funds through HKL, a partner of Kiva, to buy a cow. With this loan, she will grow her economic level. She is shown with her old mother.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Cenobia

texts.es: Cenobia tiene 66 años, está casada con Miguel D. 66 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito D. Pichari. Cenobia, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, cuyas características heredó D. sus padres. el negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. productos hecho D. plásticos como: platos descartables, baldes, bolsas D. toda medida y tinas. En un inicio no le fue bien en este negocio, pues aún no contaba con mucha clientela, pero poco a poco logró ganarse comprarse. Hoy es muy conocida, y siempre tiene salida D. sus productos. Ella no se dedica sola en este oficio, pues su esposo e hijos la ayudan en la atención y venta. En un futuro próximo desea ampliar su tienda para exhibir más productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ratifica una vez más su compromiso D. pago puntualmente. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Cenobia is 66 years old.  She is married to Miguel, aged 66, with whom she has six children.  They live together in their own house, which is located in the district of Pichari.

Cenobia is a responsible and hard-working woman, characteristics that she inherited from her parents.  The business she works in is selling products maD. from plastic, such as disposable plates, buckets, bags of every size, and tubs.  At the beginning, things didn't go too well with this business and she didn't have many customers.  However, bit by bit, she managed to gain them.  Today she is very well-known and always sells out of her products.  She doesn't work alone in this, as her husband and children help her with service and sales.

In the near future, she wants to grow her store to show more products.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she again makes her promise to pay punctually.  With the 3,000 Soles she is asking for, she will buy more products for stocking up her store.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Aireen has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Aireen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Judith has a shop that sells frozen foods like hot dogs, bacon and sausages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional frozen foods to sell. 

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Joel has a food shop that sells snacks like banana cakes, pancakes, banana & sweet potato cues. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Joel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Rinalyn

texts.en:
Rinalyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Rinalyn has a retail shop that sells sacks of rice & rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Rinalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rinalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Floravelia

texts.en:
Floravelia is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Floravelia has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Floravelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Floravelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Jackilou

texts.en:
Jackilou is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Jackilou has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from FULLERLIFE. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks from FULLERLIFE to sell.

Jackilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothes & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Paterna has a food shop where she makes & sells homemade sausages like chorizzos & longganisas. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make homemade sausages.

Paterna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients to make sausages

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Bernadette has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Bernadette has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 57 años, está casada con Jose de 60 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Ella emprendio un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de abarrotes, negocio que lo tiene en pequeño espacio de su casa. En un comienzo no le fue tan bien el negocio pues no contaba con mucha clientela pero la paciencia y la perseverancia logró mantenerse en este trabajo, además utiliza la táctica de ofrecer su productos a un precio muy cómodo y acompañado de cordialidad y atención han hecho que se gane clientes. A pesar de que ella y su pareja tiene un Bar – Recreo, en donde le permite tener otros ingresos, sin embargo ella está entusiasmada en seguir apostando en el negocio que emprendió, porque confía en que más adelante piensa tener su tienda de abarrotes mucho más amplia y completa que la de ahora. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella una vez más se compromete en realizar el pago de sus cuotas con regularidad. Ella está contenta por ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos son tenaces y responsables. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles ella comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Justina is 57 years old and is married to Jose, who is 60 years old. They have three children. They live in their own house, which is located in the Pichari District. Justina is learning a new business, selling groceries. Her business is located in a small space in her house. In the beginning her business wasn’t doing very well as she didn’t have very many customers. With patience and perseverance she was able to continue working. She offered her products at a good price and accompanied that with cordial and attentive service. She is now gaining more customers. In addition, Justina and her husband have a bar with recreational amenities, which provides them with another source of income. Nevertheless, Justina is enthusiastic about continuing with the business that she just started. In the future she hopes to have a store with a greater variety of goods than she has now. This is her second loan with MFP. This is another opportunity to show that she can pay her payments on time. She is happy to be part of this communal bank as everyone is tenacious and responsible. With this loan of 1500 new soles she will buy products in order to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal is 55 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a mechanical engineer for the railway and has been working in this position since 1973.  His daughter will live separately from him this year, so he has been trying to support her with a house.
 
But recently, he ran into financial problems with it. He needs to purchase some necessary building materials including brick, wood and window glasses to finish the building.  According to his calculation, it will be finished in this October if he can find  funding.  The loan Otgonjargal is taking out will be used to purchase building materials to finish the housebuilding for his daughter.

loans.use: buy building materials to finish a house for his daughter

loans.name: Quirico

texts.en:
Quirico is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 2 children. 

Quirico has a painting shop and provides services like tarpaulin making & painting of advertiments on cloth.  He has had this business for 21 years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw materials needed for his painting shop.

Quirico has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy materials for his paint shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 4 children. 

Jocelyn has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like caldereta, afritada & adobo. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make viands to sell.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Marivic has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, bread & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is married with 14 children. Antonia is 62 years old and lives in Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Antonia sells canned goods and other items such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc., to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products for sale.

Antonia has been a member of PMPC for 8 months. In the future, Antonia hopes to make her Sari-sari store bigger and to have a better living condition.

loans.use: To purchase food and products for her store such as shampoo,soap,oil,soy sauce,noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed and has 3 children. 

Lorenzo has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconut. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas & coconut to sell.

Lorenzo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Esterbelina

texts.en:
Esterbelina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Esterbelina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Esterbelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. 

Roselyn has a food shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients to make barbecue to sell.

Roselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients to make barbecue

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 38 años, está casada con víctor de 48 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Victoria siempre ha priorizado la calidad de sus productos agrícolas antes que todo, es por ello que sus compradores lo valoran mucho y se van satisfechos con el producto que ella les ofrece. Es por ello que siempre esta en constante cuidado con sus sembríos introduciendo nuevas técnicas agrícolas que le puedan generar productos de alta calidad. Hace 10 años que empezó con esta actividad, cuando sus padres le ofrecieron un pequeño terreno, ahí plantó cacao, pero gracias a la ayuda de su pareja sacaron provecho de la tierra que le cedieron, pero sabe que debe trabajar más para lograr tener más ganancias y con ello cubrir los gastos de su familia. Ahora que su terreno de cultivo aumentó de manera considerable, de igual forma mejoró sus ventas con respectos a los otros años. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto ratifica su compromiso de cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,300 soles que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones para podar sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en: Victoria is 38 years old and is married to Victors who is 48 years old and with whom she has 3 children. Together they live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Victoria has always put the quality of her agricultural products before everything else, and this is why her customers value her so much and are so satisfied with the product she sells. For this reason she is always careful with her crops, introducing new agricultural techniques that can yield high quality products. 10 years ago she began this business when her parents gave her a small parcel of land she planted cacao. Thanks to her partner's help she profited from the land that was given to her. She knows that she must work more to earn more income and to cover the family's expenses. Now that her farmland has appreciated considerably, she has similarly improved her sales compared with other years. This is her third loan with MFP, and so she proves her commitment to repay her debts on time. With the 2,300 soles that she asks for, she will hire workers to prune her cacao plants.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Regina has a shop that sells noodles, breads, snacks and detergents. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Regina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is 39 years of age. She is married and lives in Dumingag, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has three children. Carol has a store that sells different types of goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for 45000 PHP to purchase more products for her retail store. Carol has been a member of PMPC for two years. Carol hopes to become a big businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her retail store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.

Eva has a bakery where she sells breads and pastries including loaf breads and cakes. She has had this business for 6 years and has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy ingredients for bread making.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Precilla has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. She has had this business for 4 years and has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Precilla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Felolita Group

texts.en:
Felolita is married with 3 children. Felolita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Felolita is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.
 
Felolita has been a member of PMPC for 9 months. Felolita is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear items like T- shirts, blouses and underwear for sale

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en:
Venchita is single with no children. Venchita is 54 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Venchita sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more clothes to sell.

Venchita has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Venchita hopes to own a small store selling clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Juvy has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Juvy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juvy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
“Success is the fruit of patience and hard work,” Emiliana says.  She is 41 years old, married and blessed with three school-aged children. She and her husband manage their large crop of rice. They have been in this business for 15 years. 

Emiliana said that she has no other wealth to offer her children than education. Emiliana and her husband are doing their best and continuing to work hard for their future. She always wished to find somebody who would lend at a low interest rate to reduce her expenses in farming and increase her income.

Emiliana wants to borrow her first loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and herbicides and pay for the land preparation of her farm. She hopes that her patience and hard work will lead her to success as borrower and a farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 35 years old and lives in Tangub City. He is married with one child.

Jerry has a electronics repair business and earns approximately 15,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more equipment for his electronics repair business.

Jerry has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for his electronics repair business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Helen has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy dried fish to sell.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
 
Linda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks like breads and beverages like fruit juices . She has had this business for 3 years and has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, like  breads  and beverages like fruit juices intended for selling.

Linda became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks like breads, and beverages like fruit juices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his old house

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en:
Nisa  is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Nisa  has a shop where she sells bananas and other fruits. She has had this business for 6 years and has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy bananas and other fruits for resale.

Nisa became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and other fruits for resale

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa is married with 7 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Roquesa farms a rice field to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

Roquesa has been a member of PMPC for this year, 2011. In the future, Roquesa hopes to expand her rice fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is married with one child. She is fifty-one years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

She is a farmer and has a business at the same time to earn a living. She has been doing this since she got married. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Felicidad hopes that she can provide the needs of her family everyday.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Nancy has a business selling vegetables and spices including bell peppers, cabbages, and root crops. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more spices and vegetables for resale.

Nancy became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices for resale

loans.name: Anafer

texts.en: Anafer is 25 years old.  She lives at Mahayag, Zamboanga del sur.  She has been a member of PMPC for more than 2 years.  Anafer has had her business for almost two years.  She requested a loan of 25000 to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. In the future, Anafer hopes to be a good businesswoman so that she can support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.en:
Nurjamal, 53, is a resident of Tup, a nice village in the western part of Kyrgyzstan. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, she has raised three sons and a daughter. The two older sons are employed, the daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the youngest son is at school. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 20000 soms, Nurjamal built a store and started to sell groceries. She earns about 5000 soms per month. This profit has made it possible for her to purchase household appliances to improve the family’s living conditions. She applied for the loan because she needs to purchase more goods for trade. The loan will  be used to purchase sugar (500 kg), oil (200 liters) and other goods. Nurjamal hopes that the loan will help her to increase business turnover. In the future she wants to see her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil

loans.name: Ivy Fe

texts.en:
Ivy Fe is married with three children. She is 40 years old and lives in Pigsan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Ivy Fe sells and buys to earn a living.  She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.  Ivy Fe has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, she hopes to earn PHP 10,000 a month.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Merlita has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.
Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 6 children.

Rosalinda works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 3000 to buy 1 box of fish to sell at retail. Rosalinda joined PMPC this year. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of fish to sell at retail

loans.name: Sây

texts.en:
Farming is the most important part of 58-year-old Mrs. Sây’s daily work. She has been farming since 2003.

She and her husband have five children. Three of her children have already married and live separate houses.  The other two are working in a  sewing factory in Phnom Penh city where they earn a fixed salary each month. 

When planting season arrives, Mrs. Sây wants to buy rice seeds and fertilizer and to plow her field. Because of lack of money, she would like to request some funding from Kiva to buy seeds and fertilizer and to plow her field. Mrs. Sây is pictured in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer and to plow her field.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a God fearing person and a determined mother. While her spouse worked as a farmer, she worked abroad as a domestic helper for six years to provide for the education of her two children. After six years abroad, she decided to come back home and help her husband on the farm. They work hard planting and harvesting rice to sell. They usually sell it to local traders in the village where they live. 

Her salary earned working abroad was used for school fees and to pay for farm costs. In the last cropping season of May, she harvested about P30,000. The profit earned is not enough to cover daily expenses and farm costs so she is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides.
 
With her patience, and through the help of this loan, she could buy the necessary inputs to increase her crop production and her earnings. 
In the future, she would like to establish a hog raising business as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 
Marivel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock to sell.
Marivel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marivel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Muhtarkan

texts.en:
Muhtarkan, 58, is a resident of Tup. Unfortunately she is a widow; she has raised a daughter and a son. The daughter works in a kindergarten; she is married and lives separately with her family. The son works in construction; he lives with and takes care of his mom. Due to the high level of unemployment in Kyrgyzstan, in 1995 Muhtarkan started breeding cattle to make money. In rural areas it is the main source of income. With the loan Muhtarkan wants to purchase two cattle for breeding, fattening and reselling. In the future she wants to see her son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is 54 years old and lives in Tangub City. He is married with 3 children. 

Eddie has a used-clothing business and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more used clothing for his business. Eddie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for his business

location.town: Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Leah Group

texts.en:
Leah is 34 years old and lives in Mahayag. She is married with 2 children. 

Leah has a mango retail business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14000 to  purchase a wide-meshed basket of mango for her business.  Leah has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase a wide-meshed basket of mango for her retail mango business

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs. Ban is 29 years old and her husband is 28 years old. This sweet couple regularly thinks about how to make more income. Currently, both of them are farmers. They have been in the farming business for five years. 

The couple has one child, who is dependent on them. To earn a living in good situation, Mrs. Ban and her husband would to request some funding through HKL's partnership with Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials supporting her farming business. This is her first loan cycle with HKL's partner Kiva. In the future, Mrs. Ban will send her child to study for a high degree like the rich family in her community.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old and married to a farmer. They raise and educate two siblings. The family lives in the peaceful village of Alcala. The village's income depends on farming businesses. Virginia and her spouse plant and harvest rice and sell it to traders. With her half hectare rice field, she usually earns about P23,000. The net income from the business is not enough to sustain all their needs. She pays electric bills and buys food and grocery items for the family. 

For the next planting season, she needs additional capital of P13,000 to buy pesticides and to pay for labor to help with cultivating the rice field. She is now requesting a loan from ASKI and all the generous KIVA lenders to help her in maintaining her farming business.

In the future, Virginia hopes to achieve a plentiful harvest to generate more income to use for house repairs.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay for labor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her 4 children and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Two of her children are college students and one is a high school student. The other daughter works at the power station in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is on a disability pension. She started to sell spare parts at the local market in 1989. She has many regular clients and is very experienced in her field. With the profits from her business, she pays for her children's college tuition fees. She is planning to build a house. She is a diligent woman who is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase stock of spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.ru: Файзали проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его дети работают, и все они живут отдельно. Сам Файзали имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он уже четыре года преподает в школе. Кроме того он занимается торговлей. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает игрушки и заколки. Он берет кредит для приобретения мягких игрушек.
texts.en: Fayzali lives in the Dangara region. He is 57 years old. He is married and has three children. His children work and live separately. Fayzali has high education in teaching. He has been teaching in a school for four years now. Besides that he also does retail sales. He has a vendor location where he sells toys and bobby pins for hair. He is taking out the loan to buy soft toys.

loans.use: to buy soft toys

loans.name: 30 Giang Sơn Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huyền operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to maintain her fish stall.

Huyền is 27 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 30 Giang Sơn Hoằng Trường  solidarity group. Huyền lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huyền has been involved in this business for 7 years. Among the most critical business difficulties that concern her are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to maintain her fish stall

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Munhbat is 46 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. He remarried in 2010 after his first wife died. His two children are college students. Munhbat started to sell wood and coal at the local market in 2006. He has many regular clients after selling wood for several years. He sells wood and coal to the local public showers. He is planning to fix his home. With the profit from the business, he pays his children's tuition fees. He is a diligent man who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more wood and coal.

loans.use: To buy more wood and coal

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em, 57, is a married woman with eight children. Six of her children are married and live in separate houses; her other two children are school-age.

She now generates her income by selling fish in a market near her house. From this business, she earns about $3 each day.
