To expand her business, Em would like to request some funding through HKL's partnership with Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase more fish to sell at the market. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit and allow her to widen her house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис жительница города Куляб. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж временно не работает. Наргис занимается шитьем. У нее средне - специальное образование, она портниха. В основном она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения электрической швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nargis is a resident of the town of Kulob. She is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is temporarily not working. Nargis does sewing. She has a specialized secondary education, she is a seamstress. She mainly does custom orders at home. She has been in this business for eight years. She is taking out the loan to buy an electrical sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy an electrical sewing machine

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Entuya is 51 years old and lives with her three daughters in a house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter works at a private company, her other daughter helps in the family business and her youngest daughter is a college senior. 

Enhtuya operates a shoe trading business. She started selling men's and women's shoes at Narantuul market in 2000. Her working capital is 2,000,000 MNT and her daily sales volume is between 80,000 MNT to 150,000 MNT. The cost of the goods she sells is 60% of retail cost. She goes to Erlian city, China, to buy shoes two or three times a month. For each procurement of shoes she spends about 1 to 1.3 million MNT. She is planning to sell more shoes because of the new school year. 

Enhtuya has many years of business experience and her family supports this business. Her daughters take care of household issues and matters very well. Her middle daughter replaces her at the Narantuul market while Enhuya goes to China. She is a diligent and experienced woman who says "I want to increase my turnover capital and sales volume. If there are wide range of shoes for selection, my business goes very well." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more shoes and goods for the new school year and to increase her product range.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and goods

loans.name: El Cinco 2 Group

texts.es: Maria Aracely tiene 33 años de edad, es comerciante, miembro del Grupo Solidario El Cinco 2, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijas, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad El Cinco en el municipio de Olanchito. Maria inicio a vender ropa y sandalias hace dos años gracias a una de sus amigas, ya que ésta se dedicaba al mismo negocio y entonces le recomendo a Maria comprar donde sus proveedores y estos le dieron un buen precio. Su negocio no tiene nombre porque diariamente realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante, parte desde muy temprano por la mañana y recorre las calles de su comunidad y algunas comunidades aledañas. Su mayor dificultad no es el clima, ya que llueva o haga sol ella siempre sale a ganarse algun ingreso para el sosteniemiento de su familia, sino la mucha competencia. Maria solicita este financiamiento para comprar variedad de ropa para niños (as), mujeres y hombres, sobre todo estilos que estan a la moda y adecuados para el clima lluvioso. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio estara mejor surtido y asi podra ofrecer a sus clientes mayor diversidad. Su meta es ver a sus hijas graduandose en la universidad y tener un local propio. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Sus compañeras de grupo Maria Juana se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y Edelmira a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
texts.en: Maria Aracely is 33 years old and a businesswoman. She is a member of the solidarity group called “Five 2”. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has two children and together they live in the El Cinco Community in the Olanchito municipality. For the past two years Maria has sold clothes and sandals. She learned the business thanks to one of her friends, who is in the same business. Her friend recommended that Maria buy the necessary supplies, which the company sold to her at a good price. Her business doesn’t have a name, as she is a roving salesperson. Early in the morning she begins selling in the streets of their community and in neighboring communities. Her main difficulty is not the weather, as even if it is raining or hot she always goes out to try to earn sales in order to support her family. Maria is asking for this loan in order to buy a variety of clothes for children, women and men. She wants to buy the latest styles and clothes for the rainy climate. With the support of this loan her business will offer a greater variety of goods. Her goal is to see her daughters graduate from university and have their own place. This is her first loan with FAMA and she hopes to pay her payments on time. The fellow members of the group are Maria Juana, who sells cosmetics, and Edelmira who sells second hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
"Poverty is not a hindrance to success". Mario wants to provide a successful life for his family. He did not finish his college education due to lack of financial assistance from his parents. Mario doesn't want his children to suffer the same fate as he has experienced. He has three children and he wants to continuously send them to school and for them to have a degree someday.

Mario is 48 years old and he has been managing his farming business for 14 years. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders. He earned P30,000 in the last cropping season of May.

He is now asking for a loan of P16,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and molluscicides (pesticides for snails etc) used in farming. The income he generated last season was used to pay monthly electric bills, groceries for daily meals and school fees. Additional capital is needed in preparation for the next planting season.

In the future, he wants to have consistent profits to achieve his dream of educating all his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and molluscicides used in farming.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
His name is like a girl's name but he is proud and shouts to say, “I am a man”. Joyce is 46 years of age with two children in school. His wife is a housekeeper and manages their computer shop business, selling gadgets, encoding and printing services. She usually earns PHP 8,000 monthly and uses that for their children's allowances. 

Joyce manages his rice farming business. His business serves as additional income for his family enabling them to meet their needs. Joyce needs additional capital for his farming business. He is requesting a loan to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for farming. In the future, Joyce wants to see himself as a successful entrepreneur in the business he has now and the business he may have someday.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers, insectides and herbicides

loans.name: Alidod

texts.ru: Алидод житель города Куляб. Он женат. Ему 46 лет. У него трое детей. По профессии он товаровед. На сегодняшний день Алидод занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. В этой области он уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки газированных напитков, булочек, чая, сахара, конфет и яиц. Алидод хочет увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Alidod lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  His profession is a merchandiser.  Today, Alidod is involved in retail sales.  He has a food store.  He has been in this business for fifteen years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of carbonated drinks, buns, tea, sugar, candy and eggs.  Alidod wants to increase his goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated drinks, buns, tea, sugar, candy and eggs

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a married woman with two children who are 21 and 12 years old. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing and selling rice for 10 years. Alona earns about 8,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Alona has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Alona hopes for her business to grow. She also wants to be able to sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Dictimo

texts.en:
Dictimo is 46 years old and married to Zenaida who is a vendor selling fruits and vegetables to the people in the village where they live. The couple was blessed with three children. The eldest is going to college while the rest are getting their primary education.

Dictimo raise crops to generate income. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to local traders. He had been doing it for 10 years. The income generated from the business goes for farm maintenance, school fees, daily meals and electric bills.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. Through the help of this loan, he will be able to yield better crops and earn more profits for the next cropping season in November. 

Dictimo wants to strengthen his farming business to provide enough sustenance for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 56 years old and a married woman with 3 children. She and her husband are both farmers. They manage a rice farm in the town of Sto. Niño, in the province of South Cotabato. Cecilia works hard to improve their business and send her children to school. She has also applied for a loan to fund the farm. She plans to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne is a farmer who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is 25 years old, married and has a 5-year-old child. 

Daphne's husband works as a farmer as well. They till their own land and grow rice crops to sell. Daphne does her best to support her husband in their business and in taking care of her child.

Daphne requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds. She wishes to build her family's dream house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Муминобод. Женат. Ему 41 год. У него двое детей. Его брат живет вместе с ними. Он занимается производством муки. Сам Чамшед занимается торговлей. Он на центральном рынке района занимается торговлей арбузов. Кроме того у него имеется пекарня, где пекут хлеб и булочки для продажи. Он берет кредит для покупки муки и сахара. Еще Чамшед занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли.
texts.en: Chamshed lives in the Muminobod district.  He is 41 years old, married and has two children.  His brother, who is involved in flour production, lives together with him.  Chamshed is involved in sales.  He sells watermelons at the district's central market.  Besides this business, he has a bakery, where he bakes bread and buns for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour and sugar.  Chamshed is also involved in horticulture and has a small plot of land by his house.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar

loans.name: Artur

texts.ru:
Артур родился в 1980 г. в поселке Каварт, где и окончил сельскую среднюю школу. Артур женат, имеет двух сыновей: старшему 7 лет, учится в школе, а младшему 4 года. Жена не работает. Мать Артура живет вместе с ними. Артур работает на Капанской электростанции. 
Параллельно со своей работой на электростанции, Артур занимается сельским хозяйством: он разводит крупный рогатый скот, выращивает овощи и фрукты. А недавно Артур начал разводить кроликов на своей ферме. Выращенные овощи и фрукты, а также говядину и молоко Артур продает своим постоянным клиентам в городе Капане. Жена Артура помогает ему на ферме и таким образом они содержат семью, а также обеспечивают ее свежими и натуральными продуктами со своей фермы.
Кредит на сумму 300,000 драм необходим Артуру для покупки сена для своего крупного рогатого скота. 
Данный кредит Артура является 4-ым по счету и он никогда не задерживал выплат по кредиту.
texts.en: Artur was born in 1980 in the Kavart village, where he also graduated from a secondary school.  Artur is married and has two sons, the oldest of whom is seven years old and the youngest is four years old.  His oldest son goes to school.  Artur's wife does not work.  Artur's mother lives together with them.  Artur works at the Kapan power plant.  Parallel to this work, he is involved in agriculture.  He breeds cattle, grows vegetables and fruits.  Recently Artur began breeding rabbits on his farm.  Artur sells produced vegetables and fruits and also beef and milk to his loyal customers in the city of Kapan.  His wife helps him at the farm, and this is how they support the family and provide it with fresh and natural farm products.  Artur is requesting a loan in the sum of 300,000 dram for the purchase of hay for his cattle.  This would be Artur's fourth loan, and he has never been late repaying his loans.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano is 20 years old and still single. He lives with his mother, brothers and sister. Mariano is involved in the family farming business. He is a third year college student, taking a criminology course. Mariano is almost finished his course, which is his greatest dream, and he will have a job after graduation.

Mariano shared that his father died seven years ago. During weekend vacations, Mariano needs to help his mother manage their farm business because the profits that come from farming are used for the children's education.

Mariano wanted to borrow a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for the land preparation of their farm. He hopes to get a good harvest from their fields to gain income and be able to sustain their studies. He will also ensure that he can obtain his greatest dream, which is to help his mother in carrying their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for the land preparation

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 77 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Susana has a food shop that sells peanuts and vegetables like cabbages & squash. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy peanuts & vegetables to sell.

Susana has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Carlota has a vegetable garden. She plants & sells eggplants & string beans. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy vegetables for sell.

Carlota has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carlota hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a hardworking 21-year-old businessman who is single. For the last four years, he has been operating a quarry business to make a living. Previously he was employed as a miner. He wants in the next five years to have bought a truck for transporting the stones he mines to his clients. His dream is to be a prosperous businessman. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two wheelbarrows, a spade and three mattocks. (A mattock is a hand tool similar to a pickaxe.) Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned the art of saving.

loans.use: to buy two wheelbarrows, a spade and three mattocks

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Lorna has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from FULLERLIFE, NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.
Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Mema Group

texts.en:
Rehema is in her mid 20s and married. She has been running a grocery business for 5 years now.  She works from 6 a.m to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her 5th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania given in the middle of the main loan.  It allows borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. Rehema used the previous loans to increase her grocery, build a small house and pay household expenses,  She has repaid all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more beer, sodas, wheat flour and baking flour.  Her dream is to one day open another grocery in a different area. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mema," which has 5 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more beer, sodas, wheat flour and baking flour.

loans.name: Henny

texts.en:
Henny is a 33-year-old lady who is married to Josua who works for a private company. In their marriage, they are blessed with 4 children: Reven (16) is in third grade of senior high school, Jose (10) and Stevani (8) are both at elementary school and Tasya (5) goes to kindergarten.

Even though Josua earns income on a regular basis, Henny is willing to earn more income by running a used clothing business. Henny is grateful that she can assist her husband in generating more money for her family. From the income she can cover her family's daily needs. Moreover, her children are growing up and all of them are at school now so Henny and Josua have to finance their education.  

Fortunately Henny is assisted by her sister, who lives in Batam, who buys good quality used clothing for Henny. Henny can resell them at a fair price. She usually sells door to door, particularly to her regular customers, as she can sell out quickly.

Currently Henny plans to improve her business by purchasing more used clothing from Batam but, unfortunately, she does not have enough capital. She is seeking a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to buy more stock. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie loves to read books. She enjoys reading when she has finished doing household chores. Through her passion, she established a small bookstore in front of their house. She has been managing it for almost 5 years. She sells books such as children's short stories, dictionaries, thesaurus and encyclopedias. She usually earns about P10,000 each month. Genie has three children. Despite her low income, she always worked hard and showed determination to send all her children to school. Genie is now very proud that they have finished their education. 

Though she no longer has to support them, Genie still wants to diversify her business. She is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy books, magazines and newspapers to sell in her small bookstore.

In the future, Genie wants to construct more convenient bookshelves to stock a variety of books. In this way, she would attract more customers who might need books, magazines or newspapers to read.

loans.use: to buy books, magazines and newspapers to sell in her small bookstore.

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en:
Elgen is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Elgen has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Elgen has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elgen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a hardworking, 28-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the past 6 years, she has been selling new clothes to make ends meet. Previously, she was a house wife. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have her own exhibition and her dream is to be a wholesaler dealing in new clothes. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy men's trousers and shirts and ladies' hipsters and tops. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to access credit facilities easily.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing

loans.name: Estrillita

texts.en:
Estrillita is 59 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. She earns a living through farming. Estrillita grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to support her family and send her children to school.

Estrellita will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Mila has a shop that sells used clothing & bedding like t-shirts, bed sheets and comforters. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock of used clothing.
Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four lovely children for whom she sacrifices her whole life to raise in an educated and healthy way.
Aliya is a hard worker; she helps her husband in almost everything he needs. She started working as a tailor three years ago and worked hard on expanding her business range as much as possible. Now Aliya prepares wedding and baby souvenirs as well as selling beautiful scarfs.
Aliya loves her work a lot. She is very talented and most of her customers recommend her to other people, which helps a lot in terms of marketing for her business.
Aliya is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for the first time to buy necessary tools and materials to prepare wedding souvenirs.
Aliya hopes she can open a small shop in the future and buy a new tailoring machine which would be better than the small one she's using.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and materials for her business

loans.name: Bernabas

texts.en:
Bernabas is a 38-year-old man who is married to Frederika. In their marriage, they have 2 lovely sons: Aryanto, 7, is in 1st grade at elementary school and Melani is 5 years old. 

Bernabas is a fishmonger. He sells tuna and sardines. Bernabas has been involved in this business for almost 13 years. He is a hard worker; he usually works from 6am to 3 pm.  

Sometimes Bernabas faces difficulties in buying fish from the fisherman, particularly in the windy season, but he always does his job with pleasure.
Bernabas plans to add more fish to his range such as yellow mottle fish (“belang kuning fish”) but he needs more capital to do so. He is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to buy more fish. He is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: To add more fish to his stock, such as yellow mottle fish

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a hardworking, 29-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with one child who goes to school. For the past 5 years, he has been operating a butcher shop to make ends meet. He supplements income from this venture with the earnings he makes from his retail shop. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have a big hotel. He is requesting a loan of 40000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and sodas. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now able to save.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and sodas

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has seven years of experience working as a farmer. He owns a small plot of land where he cultivates different types of vegetables and fruits according to the season. In parallE., he has been working in a local company since 2003 to earn superior income to better support his family. 

He is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife and three school-aged children. His is the main source of income for the family. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase agricultural tools and supplies. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural tools and supplies

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Rowena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old with four children. One of the children is disabled and three of them are in school. She is a widow. She has a business of a hotel (restaurant) in Buluk in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the profit from her loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase plates, glasses and chairs for her hotel (restaurant)

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 26 and is the mother of two children. She is happy to manage her rice farming business and earns an average income of P30,000 per harvest. At present, Violeta is essentially mother and father of her children because her husband is working abroad as an Overseas Filipino Worker.
Violeta has difficulties financing her farm. That is why she is asking for a loan to pay for the services of farm laborers. She will utilize the loan wisely to help her husband support the family. 
In the future, Violeta wishes to make a profit from her farm. She plans to save some of it for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for farm laborers

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул вдова. Ей 51 год. Она проживает в районе Дангара. У нее четверо детей. Двое ее детей студенты. Ее младший сын учится в школе, а старший живет отдельно и занимается своим бизнесом. Сама Рузигул занимается шитьем. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Ruzigul is 51 years old, a widow and has four children.  She lives in the Dangara district.  Two of her sons are students.  Her youngest son attends school, and the oldest lives separately and has his own business.  Ruzigul is involved in sewing and has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics in order to make dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 20-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a car mechanic for the past four years.  Today he is the proud owner of a car repair shop. His work is specialized in changing car wheels and repairing smashed ones. 

With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to improve his business by purchasing additional tools needed. He states that these purchases will allow him to act faster while repairing cars. In the future, he is hoping to enlarge his shop and add new service which consists in selling car spare parts.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing additional tools needed

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Leah has a shop that makes and sells soft brooms. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw materials for making soft brooms.
Leah has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making soft brooms

loans.name: Tuvshintungalag

texts.en: Tuvshintungalag is 23 years old and lives with her daughter and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband transports goods in the countryside and also brings goods from China. Her family just moved into a new ger. She started selling clothes after her sister provided her with start-up goods and money in 2009. She sells clothes at Baldanzasag market. Her husband supports and helps her business. She is planning to expand her business. Her family bought a 3.5 million MNT new car which eventually will be a taxi for her husband. She is a diligent woman who says "I want to expand my business and increase my family income with my new car and my business." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts for the car and buy clothes from China.

loans.use: To buy clothes from China

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a hardworking 40-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children of whom two are in school. For over ten years now, he has been farming to provide for his family. He makes an extra shilling through his motorcycle transport business. Previously he used to sell milk. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have a vehicle for commercial purposes. His dream is to own a piece of land and develop it. He is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy a chaff cutter. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop since 1990. He is an experienced car mechanic providing his customers with the best in repair services. His job consists in fixing up car steering wheels in order to direct the vehicle in the right direction. 

Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase mechanical tools and supplies. This will be his second Kiva loan and he notes that he is planning to apply for additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is 41 years old and single. Francisco has been in the business of rice farming for 15 years. He earns about 10000 PHP per month.

Francisco plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Francisco hopes to have a stable business and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Gomiti

texts.en: Gomiti is a hardworking and visionary, 26-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged 3 years and 8 months. To make a living he has been running a school. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded his institution and opened up another school. His dream is to see his school grow into an institution of higher learning. He is requesting a loan of 35000 Kenya shillings to renovate the classrooms. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has developed the culture of saving.

loans.use: to renovate classrooms

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon believes that life must go on, whether you fail or succeed. She is 48 years old and sells AVON products. She is lucky to be married to a retired armed forces serviceman of the Philippines and they have three children.
Corazon and her husband work together for the success of their rice farming business. They always pray to the almighty to get a better yield and do their best to achieve this. At present, Corazon needs additional capital to continue operating her farm.
Corazon is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insectides. Her ambition is to continue running her farm, gain income and expand her farm area to increase her income. She would be able to send her children to college and they could finish their studies if she achieves her ambition.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for rice farming.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 38 years old. She is divorced from her husband who is working with an NGO. She has four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a hotel service business (restaurant) in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan for three years.

Lina requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to be able to purchase the requirements listed above so that she can operate her hotel and build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more water, chairs and tables

loans.name: Diab

texts.en:
Diab is a 43-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has been working as a freelance construction worker for the past 26 years. His job consists in completing wall-foliage work. During his career, Diab was able to work closely with multiple construction projects and hired two full-time employees to help him with the work. 

His wife, who works as a housekeeper, helps him with the household expenses. Today, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his purchases of construction tools and supplies for a new project he is planning to do. He has a reA. need to get extra money in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and supplies for a new project

loans.name: Narandelger

texts.en: Narandelger is 41 years old and lives with her three children and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver. He transports goods in the countryside. Her oldest son used to study at the Mongolian Agriculture University but left because he disliked the major study subject. This year, he is a college freshman at the Darhan Mining University. He says he is interested in the mining industry. Narandelger started to rent commercial space at Baldanzasag market and sell clothes in 2002. Her total assets are about 3,000,000 MNT. She gained much business experience in her field having worked as a salesperson for a decade. She has taken loans from Xac Bank 9 times previously. Her middle daughter assists her in the business while Narandelger goes to China to buy products. She is a diligent woman who says "I want to provide a good education for my son because his future depends on education." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to pay the tuition fees of her son and to buy more clothes from China for the new school year.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition fees and to buy more clothes

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 55 years old and is a married woman with 8 children. The oldest child is 39 years old and the youngest is 15.

Lily is a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Rice is the main crop that they grow to sell. Lily's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Lily runs their sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods and shampoo. Lily also makes sure her family has food on the table and that her children are healthy.

Lily has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds. In the future, she hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 
Lovelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Lovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Rosalie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and child. He has been working in the construction field for the past 12 years. He works on a freelance basis and specializes in floor coverings and cleaning. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing a floor polishing machine and new tools. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own construction office.

loans.use: to purchase a floor polishing machine and new tools

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a hardworking and determined 26-year-old businessman who is single. For the past year, he has been in the motorcycle transport business to make a living. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have a fleet of motorcycles and a vehicle. His dream is to manage a chain of proprietary businesses. He is requesting a loan of 30000 Kenya shillings to start a business selling cereals. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now business oriented.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize and green peas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao has applied for a loan from Kiva partner HKL for the betterment of her fruit-selling business. She sells different varieties of fruit in the market. She is very fair in her rates and makes good sales every day. She always gets up early in the morning to go the market because the market is far away from her house. 

Due to the long distance, she decided to buy a motorbike. She lacks money, so she would like to request some funding from HKL's partnership with Kiva.  She will use this funding to buy a motorbike to transport her fruit to the market in time. She will also use a part of the money to purchase more fresh seasonal fruit. 

She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past 6 years. Nao is confident about the positive growth of her business after the loan investment. She is the mother of ten children. Six of them are already married and live independently and the other four are enrolled in school. Taking time from studying, her children do different kinds of work to support the family financially.  In addition to her business, Nao spends her time staying at home and performing her household responsibilities. She said that this loan is very advantageous for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport fruit to market and to purchase more fresh fruit

loans.name: Lycheilyn

texts.en:
Lycheilyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Lycheilyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Lycheilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
I am continuing to dream and not lose hope that someday I will lift my family out of poverty, Ricardo says. Ricardo is full of dreams that push him to work hard and improve his strategies to attain his dreams. Ricardo is 36 years old and is married to a housewife with four children.
Ricardo is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and fuel to use in farming. Ricardo visits his farm daily to assure that his crops are not affected by any disease like neck rot and pests. His target is to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and fuel to use in farming.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a hardworking and visionary 37-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children of whom one is in school. For the past 10 years, he has been selling cereals to make a living. He makes an extra shilling by rearing poultry. Previously he was a hawker. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be a wholesaler. His dream is to own a home in Nairobi. He is requesting a loan of 70000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, maize and rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to save.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Amarbaysgalan

texts.en: Amarbaysgalan is 49 years old and lives with her three children and grandchild in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her children work at the government office. Their monthly salary is 225,000 MNT. Amarbaysgalan worked as a measurement controller at the local food factory from 1992 to 1999. When the factory was privatized, she started selling meat at the local market in 2000. She is planning to expand her business by selling other products and foods. She is a diligent woman who says "I plan to do my business in the future. I also want to help my daughter to build her home." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase meat from country people and sell it to the local market.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Ernita has a shop that provides & sells wooden lamination of pictures & other certificates. She has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to provide wooden lamination of pictures.
Ernita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ernita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to provide wooden lamination of pictures

loans.name: Christine  Joyce

texts.en:
Christine Joyce is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Christine Joyce has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nizom

texts.ru: Низом тридцати двухлетний мужчина, проживающий в районе Дангары. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Низом имеет среднее образование. Он занимается торговлей панелей телефонов, батареек для пульта, заколок и бижутерии. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки косметики и аксессуаров.
texts.en: Nizom is a thirty-two-year-old man living in the Dangara district.  He is married and has three children.  His children attend a secondary school.  Nizom has a secondary education.  He is involved in sales of telephone panels, remote control batteries, hair accessories and jewelry.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cosmetics and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 
Emilia makes and sells snacks such as rice cakes & sweetened rice, or biko. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Emilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a hardworking and committed 26-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with a two year old child. For the past 3 years she has been offering beauty salon services to meet the needs of her family. She makes an extra shilling from her rental houses. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded her business and increased profitability by 50%. Her dream is to own a supermarket. She is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy weaves, wigs, treatments and conditioners. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to be competitive in the beauty industry.

loans.use: to buy weaves, wigs, treatments and conditioners

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 53-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her youngest child still goes to school.

Lolita is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Lolita works hard to improve her business and provide for her family. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Lolita hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 30 years old and divorced from her husband who is a teacher by profession. She has one child who is in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Agnes requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more bread to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children. 
Anecito is providing motorela, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for  utilities for his service.
Anecito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anecito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for utilities for his service

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a determined 26-year-old businessman who is married. For the past 4 years he has been selling mobile phone accessories to make a living. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have opened up a phone shop. He is requesting a loan of 50000 Kenya shillings to start a new motorcycle transport business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now embraced the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Able

texts.en:
Able is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 
Able has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stock for his shop.
Able has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Able hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy is 47 years old. He is a married man living in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Presently, he is a farmer. He has run his farming business for many years with his wife. He grows rice crops in the land his parents own. From this business, he earns about $1 each day. He and his wife have six children. To assist his income, two daughters of his are working hard as sewing-factory workers in Phnom Penh city, where they earn a low salary per month. 

Due to the rainy season, he is requesting a loan in order to grow his farming business. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting the farm. He hopes that this loan will create more income in his family, and allow them to widen their house. He is shown with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking 45-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children of whom one is in school. For the last 12 years, he has been selling vegetables in order to make ends meet. He supplements his income with the earnings he makes from farming. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be a leading supplier of vegetables in the major hotels in the country. He is requesting a loan of 100000 Kenya shillings to buy courgettes and capsicum. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy courgettes and capsicum

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 21 years old and married with one child who is in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Julia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a shop for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: 5.5 Hoằng Thịnh Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Khánh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattles to raise and sell in future.

Khánh is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 5.5 Hoằng T.nh Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Khánh lives with 2 dependents in Hoằng Hoá district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Khánh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khánh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khánh has been involved in her business for 6 years. Among the most critical business difficulties that concern her are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Khánh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattles to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes makes a living planting and harvesting rice crops. She has been a farmer for 30 years. Her husband is also a farmer. They own and till land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato where they also live. They have 6 children.

Lourdes is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Davit

texts.ru:
Давиту 24 года, он живет в городе Иджеване (Ijevan) с женой, родителями и двумя сестрами. Отец Давита работает инженером, а одна из сестер работает в аптеке. Вторая сестра, мать и жена Давита безработные и занимаются домашним хозяйством.
Давит автоэлектрик и в 2007 году он переоборудовал собственный гараж в автомастерскую, где он ремонтирует автомобили и, таким образом, помогает своему отцу содержать их большую семью. Также, благодаря своему бизнесу, Давит приобрел необходимую мебель для своей семьи. 
Давиту необходим кредит на сумму 400,000 драм для частичного ремонта своей автомастерской и для приобретения автозапчастей для своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Davit is 24 years old.  He lives in the city of Ijevan together with his wife, parents and two sisters.  Davit's father works as an engineer, and one of his sisters works at a pharmacy.  His other sister, mother and Davit's wife are unemployed and are involved in household work.  Davit is an auto electrician and converted his own garage into an auto repair shop in 2007, where he repairs cars and, thus, helps his father to support their large family.  Also, thanks to his business, Davit purchased necessary furniture for his family.  Davit needs a loan in the sum of 400,000 dram for a partial repair of his auto repair shop and purchase of auto parts for his business.

loans.use: to partially repair his auto repair shop and to buy auto parts for his business

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy is 46 years old. He is a married man living in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Presently, he is a farmer. He has generated income from his farming business for many years with his wife. He grows rice crops in the land his grandparents own. From this business, he earns about $2 each day. He and his wife have four children. To assist his income, three children of his are working hard as garment and sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh city, where they earn a suitable salary per month. His other children are in school. 

Due to the rainy season and the lack of capital, he is requesting a loan in order to grow his farming business. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting his farming business. He hopes that this loan will create more income in his family to widen their house. And on the other hand, he will send his children to study at a high level, as others.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a hardworking 28-year-old businessman who is single. For the past two years he has been doing carpentry to make a living. He supplements his income from farming. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded his workshop. His dream is to be the carpenter of choice for the clients out there. He is requesting a loan of 30000 Kenya shillings to buy a saw, hammer, nails and wood. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: to buy a saw, hammer, nails and wood

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 young children aged 6 and 4. Marites and her husband are both farmers. They grow and sell rice. Marites's husband mainly manages their rice farm and she spends time selling dried fish to their neighborhood and taking care of her children. 

Marites has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anjella

texts.en:
Anjella is 37 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling chalk in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Anjella requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chalk to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 54, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Robert, an overseas contract worker, and is mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. She continually works hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Julieta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns through Electronic Cellular Phone Loading Station. She buys electronic cellular phone load in quantity and then retails it to customers according to usage. Profit is generated depending on the network's policy of dealership. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.     

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julieta hopes to be able to expand soon as she hopes to visit her husband in Saudi Arabia where he works. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
This is Luz, 50, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a maintenance worker and has one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She continually works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luz operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Luz hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes for her husband to have a permanent job. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ribhya

texts.en:
Ribhya is a 53-year-old married woman with six sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a taxi driver. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. She also has an income from working in agriculture. Ribhya has a taxi that makes internal and external trips. She wants to replace the old taxi with a bigger new one. She has part of the payment, but she needs to add to her savings by taking out a loan from FATEN for $3,000.

When Ribhya gets this loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will have the full amount of money she needs to pay for replacing the old taxi she owns with a new bigger one. This will increase her income and allow her family to live in better conditions. Ribhya and her husband are photographed near the old taxi that she wants to replace.

loans.use: to add to her savings to purchase a new taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, wheat flour and soft drinks

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is in his forties and is engaged in rice farming. He is married and has three children who go to school. Fidel has been patiently managing his farm business for almost 15 years. His profits were spent on school fees for his children.
Fidel's wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their farm. Fidel dreams that somebody will lend to him at a low interest rate for the maintenance of his farm. Thus, Fidel is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care. The loan will be the answer to his dreams.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 53 years old and lives in Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow who has two children, one is currently employed and the other is in college. Together with her children, Basilia manages the household while she also operates her business which is making and selling doormats. She works hard to constantly provide an income to meet their everyday expenses.

Basilia handcrafts her doormats and sells them to her neighbors and the local community, as well as to suppliers. Aside from weaving doormats, she also sells items such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct selling brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other brands. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day.

Basilia is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to help continue her business operations and buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric and thread to weave doormats. She expects a boost in her business income as her business expands. Basilia hopes that her daughter finishes her college degree. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to weave doormats

loans.name: Khot

texts.en:
Khot is a 29 year-old woman living in Baray district, Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. She is married to Nan, who is in the same age.  The couple has three children who are not yet old enough for school. 

Khot and Nan have a small fishing business. After fishing, Khot brings her fish to sell at the local market, which is far away from her community. She spends time riding a bicycle to the market every day. She and her husband have decided to purchase a new motorbike to allow them to transport their business in time. Due to the lack of money, Khot wishes to borrow some funds through HKL's partnership with Kiva.

This is Khot's third cycle of using a loan from HKL and the first cycle from Kiva.  Based on the use of loans from one cycle to another, this family is getting better and better. In the future, they want to live in a bigger house and send their children to university.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to transport their business in time.

loans.name: Batmabu's Group

texts.en:
Batmabu is the treasurer of this group. She is 27 and married and her husband works as an electrician. At the moment Batmabu works in a dental clinic. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 6,000 KGS, the family started breeding livestock. By fattening and reselling their animals, they earn additional 3000 KGS. 

Batmabu is requesting a loan to improve her family’s living conditions and purchase furniture for their home. In the future, she hopes to expand her livestock business and be able to build a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 40 years old and is married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Clarita has operated a shop where she sells bananas and coconuts. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Clarita is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more coconuts and bananas to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old and married with five children. She earns a living as a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 27 years. Marlyn works hard to increase her earnings and help provide a better quality of life for her family. She earns about 10,000 PHP a month. 

Marlyn is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes her business will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 41 years old and is married with three children. He lives in the Philippines. For the past eight years, Ramon has run a shop where he sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Ramon is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise for his store. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Junita

texts.en:
Junita is 35 years old and is married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Junita has run a shop where she sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

Junita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, bread, and cooking fat

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Veronic, who is in her late 30s, is a widow with two children, one of whom attends school.  She has been running a vegetable business for five years. She works from 5 a.m to 9.30 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her vegetable stock and pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to go upcountry and buy about 4 sacks of fresh garlic.  Her dream is to one day be able to have good capital and start another business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Lindi," which has 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To go upcountry and buy about 4 sacks of fresh garlic.

loans.name: Mukhamed

texts.ru:
Мухамед трудолюбивый, честный и добрый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 15 лет он занимается  купля продажей мужских брюк, костюм и сорочек. Когда первый раз он получил кредит от Имон Интернэшнл в размере 600$ США, дал ему хороший прибыль, а потом постепенно он увеличил размер кредита. В прошлом году когда рынок сгорел Имон Интернэшнл не требовал у него проценты а наоборот поддерживал его, ему дали льготный срок для того чтобы он мог без всяких трудностей погасит займ . Теперь он хочет еще получит займ- это будет помогать ему купить много товаров по низкой цене и продать по рознице и он будет получить хорошую прибыль. Он благодарен Имон Интернэшнлу и Киве за поддержку и милосердие.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mukhamed is a hard-working, honest and kind person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He has been involved in buying and selling of men's trousers, suits and shirts.  When he first obtain a loan in the sum of $600 from Imon International, he made a good profit, and then he gradually began increasing his loan amounts.  Last year, when the market burned down, Imon International did not demand interest, but instead supported him by extending his repayment term, so that he could repay his loan without any difficulties.  Now, Mukhamed wants to obtain another loan, which would help him to buy a lot of goods at low prices, then sell them at retail prices and make a good profit.  He is grateful to Imon International and Kiva for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 45 years old and is widowed with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has been raising and selling pigs. Andresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

Andresa is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to buy feed for the animals she is raising to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 49 years old and married with five children. She is a farmer who lives with her family in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Her eldest child is 24 years old. Mary Jane helps her husband till their land and plant rice crops and she also helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests. She rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest and earns about 10,000 PHP each month. 

Mary Jane is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, seed and insecticides. In the future, she hopes to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 43 year-old married lady who sells used clothes at the old market in Malindi. She  has been in this business for the past year, and she earns a monthly income of  KES 30,000, which she uses to help look after her family as well as to run her business. 

Patience has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD.  This is her second loan.  She intends to use the loan to purchase additional stock of used clothes for her business with the aim of expanding it, due to the rise in her clientele in the region. 

She hopes to use some of her anticipated profit to continue running her business as well as to continue saving a portion of it so as she will able to run her own boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is a 44 year-old married man who lives in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia  He is the father of one son who is dependent on him. He is a very hard-working and good man. He is appreciated by all his friends and neighbors because he always helps others and does well.

Ya has been farming for more than 15 years. Due to the rainy season and lack of money, Ya would like to request some funding through HKL's partnership with Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials. He hopes that this funding will develop his family better and better, and send his child to study at high level as others.  Ya is pictured with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is proud that she belongs to the Igorot tribe. She is 55 years old and a widowed mother with five adult children. At her age, Anita still has her healthy body and does field work that is her source of income. She also shares her belief that the Igorot are physically fit. Anita manages her farming business and plants and harvests rice. Her business has allowed her to provide for her children in spite of being alone. This is why Anita loves farming.

Anita is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to sustain her farm and so she won’t lose her source of income despite her lack of financial resources. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide for her crops and as well as seed to plant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, and seed

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Celina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase or order for more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mariejo

texts.en: Mariejo is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Mariejo owns a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and breads; she has had this business for two years. She also provides computer services, such as online computer games. Mariejo requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mariejo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Azganush

texts.en:
Azganush is from the village of Anoushavan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is a widow with a thirty year old daughter.  She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for the past twenty years.  She provides economic support to her mother and sister.  

Azganush considers herself to be a hardworking, honest person.  She hopes to save enough money to renovate the family home.  She would like a loan to purchase additional livestock.  She expects her income to increase by twenty percent with this investment.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and the prices are reasonable.  She wants to continuing living in Anoushavan, surrounded by her relatives and friends.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Tegera, leader du groupe d’affaire «Ujumbe »,est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient encore à l’école primaire. Elle est vendeuse de ciments et matériaux de construction. Son mari est maitre maçon. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un dépôt situé au long de boulevard ULPGL. Il y a 8 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 40 sacs de ciments à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et agrandir son entreprise. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Tegera is a client and the leader of the business group "Ujumbe". She is a young entrepreneur, 35 years old, and the mother of six little children, who are still in primary school. She is a seller of cement and construction supplies and equipment. Her husband is a master mason. She sets up her merchandise in a warehouse located along ULPGL Blvd. She has been working in small-scale revenue-generating businesses like these for eight years. 

However, Tegera just completed nine loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve to provide her with 40 sacks of cement to sell. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her business. 

Our client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to pay for 40 sacks of cement

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Emma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and breads. She has had this business for five years. Emma requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a hardworking, 28 year old businessman. He is married and blessed with a six-month old child. For the last four years, he has been selling phones and their accessories to make a living. Over the next five years he wants to expand his business. His dream is to become a leading distributor of phones in his whole region. Boniface is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy phones and accessories. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has acquired business management skills.

loans.use: to buy phones and accessories.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun is a 56-year-old woman who is married and has five children. Three of her children have already married and live independently. The other two of her children are working as local construction workers in Phnom Penh city, where they earn a low salary per month. 

She has been running a business as a mix goods seller in front of her house. Khun wants to buy more products to sell in her store but she doesn't have enough cash to pay for them. Therefore, she wants to request some funds for supporting her business. 

When Khun receives funds from HKL, a Kiva partner, she will be able to purchase goods to add to her store. She hopes to sell more products and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. He operates a retail shop in the Mtangani area in Malindi town. The business has been in existence for the past three years now, and the client gets a monthly income of about KES 30,000. 

Peter has applied for a loan of KES 80,000 from KADET Ltd., and this will be his third loan with KADET. He intends to use the loan to buy food like maize flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpastes and sweets for sale.

Peter will use the anticipated profit from the business to provide for his family, and in the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock like maize flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpaste and sweets.

loans.name: Melie

texts.en:
Melie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Melie has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Melie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Torgom

texts.en:
