Torgom lives in the Shirak region of Armenia, in the town of Artik.  He is married with two daughters (three and five years old).  He is a dentist and has been practicing for the past eight years.  In addition to supporting his family he takes care of his parents.  

Torgom hopes to open a separate dental practice.  He is looking for a loan to purchase new dental equipment.  He is pleased with the prices and customer service of microfinance.  He expects his business investment to increase his clients and income by fifteen percent.  He is proud of living in Artik and the friendly atmosphere of the town.

loans.use: to purchase dental equipment

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Elna has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Elna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marilyn's priority is preparing for her children's education so they can become professionals someday. She is 46 years old and married to a farmer. They are blessed with three school-age children.

Marilyn says that education, rather than wealth, is the best treasure they can give to their children. She strives with her husband so they can send their children to school to finish their studies. In fact, Marilyn also does farm activities just to lessen the farming labor costs.

Marilyn is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides needed in rice farming. She hopes to succeed in this type of business and be able to make her priority become reality.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides needed in rice farming.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Virgincita has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell in her store.

Virgincita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 49 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Nadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a big shop for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Baragul's Group

texts.en:
Baragul is the leader of this group. She is 59 and married to a veterinarian. Together they have raised three daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and the sons are working in Russia. Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 12000 soms, Baragul started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock allows her to contribute an additional 4000 soms to the family budget. She has applied for a loan because she needs additional funds to increase her number of livestock. In the future, Baragul hopes to see her sons wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Ester has a shop that sells animal feed by the kilogram. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy sacks of animal feed for sale.

Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed for sale.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
This is Emelyn, 30, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rommel, a farmer, and is a mother of two children. Together with her husband, Emelyn manages her own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Emelyn operates a river spinach farm. She grows river spinach, or kang kong in our native language, in their farm located in Cavite.  River spinach is easy to maintain and grows where there's a lot of water. The tender, hollow stems of kang kong are used in cooking as well as its leaves.  It can be stir-fried, steamed, boiled, or lightly fried in oil. Emelyn sells her product to market stalls that she regularly supplies and also to the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales each day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000. She will be using the loan to buy farm inputs for her business, and for the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Emelyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, materials, and maintenance needed in her business.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is 46 years old. He is married and has four children. He is known to be a hardworking father. Loreto believes that a man cannot achieve success without working on it. Being the head of the family, Loreto involves himself in raising crops. He plants and harvests rice to sell. Early in the morning, whether the day is sunny or rainy, he goes down the field and checks on his rice to ensure that no pests, such as snails and insects, will harm his crops. He has been very patient in maintaining his farming business, but due to a typhoon affecting his area, the crop season of May was lost for him. He only gained about P20,000 for his half-hectare rice field. He uses this money for food, monthly electric bills, and daily allowances for the children.

Loreto is requesting a loan of P14,000 to buy seeds and pesticides for his farm. 

Every crop season, Loreto hopes to achieve plentiful harvest to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Ma. Rolenda

texts.en:
Ma. Rolenda is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Ma. Rolenda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Ma. Rolenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ma. Rolenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Matevos

texts.en:
Matevos resides in the village of Zuygaghbyur in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married and looking forward to having children.  He has a law degree, but due to the economic conditions of Armenia, has been self-employed as a farmer for the past five years.  He considers himself to be a hardworking, honest person and dreams of having a large farm.  

Matevos is looking for a loan to purchase additional calves.  According to his business plan this investment will increase the family income by twenty percent.  He has been pleased with the quality service of microfinance.  With favorable conditions for grazing cattle in his birth town of Zuygaghbyur, Matevos is optimistic his business with grow.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, and soda for his retail shop.

loans.name: Yakob

texts.en:
Yakob is a 45-year-old farmer who lives in his own house with two children.  Adrian, 20, is studying in Local University and Indra, 17, is studying at the 2nd grade of Senior High School. His wife passed away a year ago, so Yakob is responsible of taking care of his children. Yakob has a plot of land that supports him by generating money. He cultivates paddy and corn at the farm. Due to the limited irrigation, Yakob could not generate much money from the harvest.

Because of this, Yakob is planning to try another business: he would like to buy crops such as rice, corns, pumpkins, green beans, bananas, and cassavas from other farmers and then resell them in local markets. 

Yakob is seeking a loan of 10,000,000 from TLM to purchase these crops. He is hoping that TLM will assist him by providing a loan for his business.

loans.use: to purchase crops (e.g: rice, corns, pumpkins, green beans, bananas, and cassavas) to sell at local markets.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with five children.
 
Edna has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

loans.name: Julie Huguette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 51 ans,mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 22 ans.Ayant considérée les charges de sa grande famille en 2000,  elle se lance dans le commerce des divers tel que, habits d'hommes, des dames ,des mèches et articles de tout genre.
Elle commence avec une somme de 80.000frs, a l'heure actuelle, elle a des revenus de 20.000 a 40.000 frs par jour.
A l'octroi de son prêt elle va acheter des pagnes, des habits de dames, des blouses, des habits d'hommes, des sandales, des mèches et tout produits a la mode qui attire les clients.
Tres entreprenante, elle s'approvisionne dans les grands magasins de la place, les commerçants de Cotonou et Kinshasa.
Elle a pour ambition d’ouvrir une boutique et avec ses bénéfices , elle pense epargner et avec le temps soutenir les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Julie Huguette is 51 years old, married and the mother of 5 children aged between 5 and 22 years. In 2000, having considered the costs of supporting her large family, she made her start in retailing, selling items like men´s and women´s clothing, hair extensions and other diverse products. She started out with 80 000 francs and currently makes between 20 000 and 40 000 francs a day. 
She will use this loan to buy some "pagnes" (traditional sarong-like clothing), women's clothing, blouses, men's clothing, sandals, hair extensions and any fashionable items which may draw the customers in. A very enterprising woman, she gets her supplies from the local department stores and shops in Cotonou and Kinshasa, and she eventually plans to open her own store. She will use the profits to pay for her children´s education and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy men´s and women´s clothing, hair extensions and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru:
Насибахон умная, добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и у них 4 детей. Её муж уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать денег и вернутся с большим доходам.  Она сама кормит своих детей и старается, содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Она продает детскую одежду более 10 лет. Насибахон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимум дохода. Она мечтает, подстроит свой собственный магазин. С этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 900$ США . Она заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: N. is a smart, kind and goal-oriented woman.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband left to go to Russia in order to earn money and come back with large profits.  N. is supporting her children on her own and tries to provide a good quality of life for them.  She has been selling children's clothing for over ten years.  N. wants to expand her business and maximize her profits.  She dreams of building her own store.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $900 for this goal.  She thanks all creditors in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Reala

texts.en:
Reala is 40 years old with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling onions and groundnut paste in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Reala requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a hardworking 29-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a 3-year-old child. 

He has been offering electrical services to make a living. For the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business by expanding his clients and establishing an electrical firm.

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shilling to buy electrical items. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To buy electrical items.

loans.name: 13 Thành Xuân Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mai is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. Mai lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 13 Thành Xuân Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

In 2004, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mai operates a food stall, selling fish. Mai has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardships that Mai faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies and equipment for her business.

In the future, Mai hopes to buy more land, to maintain her business, and to be happy and healthy.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Alma has a shop that sells snacks like pan (bread), rice and cassava cakes. Her husband is providing motorela or habal-habal motorcycle-transportation services. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель района Дангары. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки дыни, арбуза, яблок, груши и инжира.
texts.en: Safarali lives in the Dangara district.  He is 38 years old, married and has two children.  He has a secondary education and has been involved in sales at the market for over 10 years.  He sells fruits.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cantaloupes, watermelons, apples, pears and figs.

loans.use: to purchase cantaloupes, watermelons, apples, pears and figs

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a determined business man aged 37 years. He is married. For the last seven years he has been operating a retail shop in order to support his family. In the next five years, he wants to have established his business as a wholesale one. His dream is to be a successful business man. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 to buy flour, salad, rice, and soap. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy flour, salad, rice, and soap for his store.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 35, lives with her husband and three young children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. All of her children are school-age. 

Currently, she is a vermicelli seller in a market far away from her community. From this business, she earns about $3 per day. To augment her income, her husband is a carpenter who is able to make around $4 each day. 

They spend a lot of money for taxis, and therefore, she and her husband wish to borrow some funds in order to purchase a motorbike. She hopes that this will bring her family more profits and more happiness.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Batyi's Group

texts.en: Batyi is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married; her husband went to work in Russia. Batyi has raised two daughters and a son; the daughters are married and the son studies at university. In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, Batyi breeds livestock; her son helps her in this activity. With the profits gained from reselling livestock, she was able to build a sauna near the house. With money received from the loan, Batyi wants to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to see her son get wed. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Meguela

texts.en:
Meguela is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Meguela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Meguela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Meguela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest is 7 years old.

Mylene is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She helps her husband cultivate their land and grow rice crops. Mylene also sells fish to the people in her community. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a better income and be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Emelie has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, detergents and snacks. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Emelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rosesa

texts.en:
Rosesa is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Rosesa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosesa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosesa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en: Dishon is a determined business man aged 29 years. He is married and blessed with a a two-and-a-half year-old child. For the last 13 years, he has been operating a barber shop to bring up his family. He supplements income from this venture with the earnings he makes from farming and selling car spare parts. Previously, he was selling cosmetics. In the next 5 years, he wants to have a wholesale business dealing with car spare parts. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy car spares part. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now business oriented.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts for his supplementary business

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en: Ninfa is a farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She and her husband till their land together, growing and selling rice crops. They also raise cows. Ninfa works hard to support her family. She requested a loan because they do not have the capacity to fund their farm right now. She plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs. Ninfa hopes to provide three meals a day for her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 59 years old and married. She has 14 children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Hope runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Hope has been in this business for 26 years, and she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap, noodles, etc.
 
She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

In the future Hope would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma lives in the Shirak region of Armenia, in the village of Shirakavan.  She is the proud mother of three sons (eleven, seventeen and eighteen years old).  Together with her husband she has been working on the family farm for eighteen years.  She dreams of having all three of her sons receive a university education.  

Jemma is a hardworking person and has become an experienced farmer.  She is grateful for the services of microfinance, especially that the loan disbursements are efficiently organized.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds for autumn planting.  This loan will increase her investment in the family farm by thirty percent and produce additional income of fifteen percent.  The conditions for agriculture are favorable in Shirakavan.  Farming is the main source of income for the villagers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama is 28 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She has a business selling beer in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Rahama requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beer to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is an active business woman aged 32 years. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last 8 years she has been vending water in order to meet the needs of her family. She makes an extra shilling from the rent she collects from her rental houses. In the next 5 years, she wants to enlarge her business and penetrate into other regions. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she can now access credit facilities easily.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his taxi and purchase a motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.name: Norata

texts.en: Norata is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She and her husband are both farmers. Norata helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. Aside from rice farming, Norata also raises pigs in their backyard. She works hard to support her family. Norata has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pig feed. She hopes to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pig feed

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from the village of Zuygaghbyur in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She has a university degree and has been engaged in farming for the past twenty years.  With her honesty and hard work, she hopes to continue growing her business.  

Tamara is looking for a loan to purchase fuel to harvest hay.  She prefers microfinance institutions because of their products and customer friendly attitude.  With this investment she expects her income to increase by twenty percent.  This loan will increase her total investment in the business by twenty five percent.  Tamara enjoys the nature of Zuygaghbyur and lives close to her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to harvest hay

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a beauty salon business in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a widow who lives in the Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. She has five children. All of her children are married. Four of her children are living in separate houses but one child is living with her. 

She works as a Khmer traditional medicine seller. She earns perhaps US $2 per day. 

To upgrade the family living situation, her son, who lives with her, runs a business as a junk goods collector around village and other communities. From this business, he earns approximately $5 per day. 

Currently, her son wishes to purchase more junk goods, but he lacks equity. Therefore, Chea and her son would like to request some funds through HKL, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase more junk goods. 

She and her son hope that this loan will add to their income and increase their happiness. They are very thankful to all lenders that support her family in this time.

loans.use: to purchase more junk goods.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина проживает в районе Дангары. Ей 36 лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Двое ее детей учатся в средней школе, а другой ребенок у нее маленький. Нигина имеет среднее образование. Она предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кредит берет для приобретения электрической швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nigina lives in the Dangara district.  She is 36 years old, a widow and has three children.  Two of her children attend a secondary school, and her other child is still small.  Nigina has a secondary education.  She provides a service and sews national dresses.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.ru:
Рукия замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она добросовестная и честная женщина. Она занимается купля продажей детских и взрослых обувей и более 20 лет она занимается этим бизнесом и каждый год старается расширить свой бизнес и добавить новых других видов обуви. Она мечтает устроит своих детей в лучшую школу города для этого она  хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Рукия хотела бы получит займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки детских и взрослых обуви. Она надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать её.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rukiya is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is a conscientious and honest woman.  She has been involved in buying and selling of children's and adult shoes for over 20 years and tries to expand her business every year by adding new types of shoes into her merchandise selection.  Rukiya dreams of placing her children into the best school in the city and, for this purpose, wants to expand her business and maximize her profits.  Rukiya is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of children's and adult shoes.  She hopes that the creditors will support her.

loans.use: to purchase children's and adult shoes

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a hard-working 58 year-old business man. He is married and blessed with a 28 years old child. For more than ten years now, he has been operating a general shop so as to make a living. He makes an extra shilling from the rent he collects from his rental houses and the earnings from supplying milk. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded his business and increased his clientele. He is requesting a loan of 60000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, salt and utensils. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to make wise investments and to plan and budget his finances.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, salt and utensils

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en:
Soeu is 39 years old, married and living in Ornlong Veng District, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

Currently, he is a farmer. He has done farming for many years with his wife. He grows rice crops in the land his grandparents own. From this business, he earns about $3 each day. 

He and his wife have given birth to two children. They are school-age. 

Due to the rainy season and the lack of capital, he is requesting a loan in order to grow his farming business. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting his farming business. He hopes that this loan will create more income for his family so he can enlarge his house and send his children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Ludah

texts.en: Ludah  is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a pigpen in which she raises and then sells grown, matured pigs. She has had this business for 6 years, and has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard resides in the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three sons (twenty, twenty-four and twenty-six years old).  She has a college degree with training as an economist.  With limited employment opportunities in her field, she has been a self-employed farmer for the past twenty years.  

Alvard is looking for a loan to purchase seeds for the autumn planting.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by twenty percent.  It will also increase her investment in the farm by forty percent.  She is pleased with microfinance services and products as everything is well organized.  She enjoys her life in Isahakyan; the village is tranquil and the air if fresh. She hopes her children will have happy lives and is looking forward to grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for dress-making

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to buy a plot.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a hardworking 47 year old businesswoman. She is single and a proud mother of 5 children, four of whom are in school. For the last 5 years she has been offering hotel services in order to meet the needs of her family. In the next 5 years, she wants her business to have expanded. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wheat flour and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to access credit easily.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Rab'aa

texts.en: Rab'aa is a 47-year-old married woman with seven sons and three daughters. Some of her sons are employed and others work in agriculture. Rab'aa has a store for selling home appliances. She wants to buy a large number of home appliances to improve her collection and to increase her income. The amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take out a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. With her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, Rab'aa will purchase more home appliances and have a larger collection to sell. Her income will increase and this will improve her family's living conditions. Rab'aa is photographed in her store.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of home appliances to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Tao

texts.en:
Tao is a 43-year-old married woman living in the Reussey Keo Commune. 

Currently, she is a farmer. She has been farming for many years with her husband. She grows rice crops on land her grandparents own. From this business, she earns about $2 each day. 

She and her husband have given birth to two children. They are school-age. 

Due to the rainy season and the lack of capital, she is requesting a loan in order to grow her farming business. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting her farming business. 

She hopes that this loan will create more income for her family so that they can enlarge their house and send her children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 23-year-old married woman.

She has been in the clothing business for the past two years, and from it, she gets a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has been loaned KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. This is her first loan, and she intends to use her loan to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

With the anticipated profit, she wishes to continue running her business as well as continue saving a portion of it so that she can run her own boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 3 children.  For the past 8 years, she has had a shop where she sells green & yellow bananas. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more green & yellow bananas to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more green & yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. Nancy has a store that sells construction supplies: sacks or loads of sand, gravel, and stones. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy additional sacks or loads of sand, gravel, and stone to sell. Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and stone

loans.name: Guy Saturnin

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 15 ans, a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de terminale, il se lance dans  la vente du pétrole lampant.
Il avait pour stratégie d'acheter  du pétrole dans des bidons de 25 litres dans les stations et revendre au marche en détail.
A l'octroi de son prêt, il va acheter 1000litres de pétrole lampant qu'il vend en litres et demi litres dans le marche, surtout les jours ou il y'a coupure d'électricité.
Ses ventes ont augmentes  de 30.000 a 50.000 frs , il pense a épargner pour atteindre son objectif celui d'ouvrir une mini-station pour satisfaire la consommation journalière de ses potentiels clients.
Avec ses réelles bénéfices, il  subvient aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Guy Saturnin is 41 years old, married and the father of 4 children aged between 3 and 15 years. After high school, he started selling paraffin. He buys it from petrol stations in 25 liter cans and resells it at the market.
He will use this loan to buy 25 000 liters of paraffin which he will sell at the market in liter and half-liter quantities. His sales amounts have increased from 30 000 to 50 000 francs, and he plans to save up so that he can open a mini petrol station and satisfy the daily demands of the potential customers in the area. He will use his profits to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 1000 liters of paraffin.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 
Marisa has a shop that sells cosmetics  other ready to wear products like shoes, sandals, jeans and shirts from NATASHA , MSE  and AVON Company.. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA, MSE & AVON.
Marisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON

loans.name: Ozodamoh

texts.ru: Озодамох жительница города Вахдат. Ей 24 года. Она замужем. У нее детей нет. Она имеет высшее медицинское образование. Она год проработала в больнице города, гинекологом. На сегодняшний день она занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Она берет кредит для закупа скота.
texts.en: Ozodamoh lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 24 years old, married and has no children.  She has a higher medical education and spent one year working as a gynecologist at the city hospital.  Today, she is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  Ozodamoh has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Khosiyatkhon

texts.ru:
Хосиятхон умная, воспитанная и честная женщина. Она разведена и у неё 3 детей. Она  одна занимается купля продажей детских и взрослых обувей, и с прибылью, которая она получает из бизнеса, тратят на обеспечение своих детей.  Более 7 лет она занимается этим бизнесом, и каждое утро она рано уходит из дома и вечером вернется. Хосиятхон усердно работает для того чтобы содержит своих детей в хороших условиях жизни и она хочет, устроит своих детей в лучших школах и садиках. Хосиятхон запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки детских и взрослых обуви. Она заранее благодарна всем кредиторам за поддержу и доброты. Спасибо большое!  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Khosiyatkhon is a smart, well-mannered and honest woman.  She is divorced and has three children.  She is involved in buying and selling children's and adult shoes, and with a profit, which once made, she spends on providing for her children.  Khosiyatkhon has been in this business for seven years, leaves her home early every day and returns in the evenings.  She works diligently in order to provide a good quality of life for her children and wants to place her children into the best schools and kindergartens.  Khosiyatkhon is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of children's and adult shoes.  She thanks all creditors in advance for the support and kindness.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to purchase children's and adult shoes

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Vilma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit is from the village of Metz Sepasar in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with a twenty eight year old son and a twenty seven year old daughter.  She has professional training as an accountant and has been working as a self-employed farmer for over thirty years.  Due to the difficult economic situation in Armenia she also supports her daughter’s family.  Her hard work over the years has given Margarit the opportunity to build a family house.  She dreams now to renovate the home.  Margarit is looking for a loan to purchase livestock.  According to her business plan this investment will increase the family income by twenty percent.  This is also a ten percent increase in the total investment in her ongoing business.  She appreciates the opportunity to grow her business from access to microfinance.  The microfinance services are well organized and customer friendly.  She enjoys living in her birthplace Metz Sepasar close to family and friends.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Clarita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Clarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Clarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Cissin Wendteldo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Habibata est la représentante du groupe CISSIN WENDTELDO. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgé a 7ans.03 vont à l’école et elle à 06 personnes en charge.

Elle est tisseuse et vend parallèlement du bagbenda (plat traditionnel du Burkina) depuis 07 ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10,au marché de Pissy et au marché de Cissin. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et ses voisins.

Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 1/2 kg de teinture, 01balle de fils et 25 kg de légumes pour son bagbenda.

Ses économies vont servir à la scolarisation des ses enfants et à la construction d’une maison d’habitation. Elle a comme ambitions assurer l’avenir de ses enfants et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Ms. Habibata is the representative of the group CISSIN WENDTELDO. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 24 years old, and the youngest is 7. Three of the children go to school. She has six persons to support. Ms. Habibata is a weaver and has also been selling bagbenda (a traditional meal in Burkina Faso) for seven years. She gets her supplies at the market of Sector 10, at the Pissy market, and the Cissin market. Her customers are women, men, and her neighbors. With the money granted to her, she wants to buy ½ kg of dye, a ball of yarn, and 25 kg of vegetables for making bagbenda. Her savings will serve to provide schooling for her children and to build a house in which to live. Her ambition is to ensure her children's future and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ½ kg of dye, a ball of yarn, and 25 kg of vegetables for making "bagbenda"

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет высшее образование, преподаватель. По профессии работает 31 год. Кроме того в свободное от работы время она занимается животноводством. В этой области она 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Sabohat lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 50 years old, married and has two children.  She has a higher education and is a teacher.  She has been working in this field for 31 years.  Besides this work, she is involved in animal husbandry in her spare time.  She has been involved in this business for 12 years.  She is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en: Sonik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Ashotck. She is married and has three sons (20, 24, and 26 years old). She has a college education. Sonik has been engaged in farming for the past 20 years. Known as a hardworking, honest person, she has developed deep experience in agriculture. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase feed and to fix the cattle shed. She expects this investment to increase the family income by 25%. This is her sixth microfinance loan; she is pleased with the high quality of service. Sonik was born in Ashotck and hopes to live the rest of her life in her birthplace.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to fix the cattle shed

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам более 14 лет занимается бизнесом. Он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей детских одежд, а потом перешел на изготовления и продажа сырого кирпича. Он хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях и устроит своих детей в школах. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его старший сын, который составляет ему 16 лет. Рустам хочет расширить свой бизнес и покупать необходимое сырьё для изготовления кирпича. Этот займ будет 4 циклом, который он получает от Имон Интернэшнл. Все займи, который он получал, дал ему хороший прибыл и расширился бизнес. Рустам благодарен Киве и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрения.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rustam has had his own business for over 14 years.  He started his business with buying and selling children's clothing and then transitioned into making and selling raw bricks.  He wants to provide good living conditions for his family and place his children into schools.  His oldest son, who is 16 years old, helps him with this business.  Rustam wants to expand his business and buy the necessary materials for making bricks.  This will be his fourth loan from Imon International.  All of the previous loans helped him make good profits and expand his business.  Rustam is grateful to Kiva and Kiva creditors for their help and support.

loans.use: to purchase materials for brick making

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en: Astghik is from the village of Vahramaberd in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is the proud mother of a 29-year-old daughter and a 25-year-old son. Astghik has a high school education. She has been farming with her husband for 20 years. She is working hard to grow her business and save money for the future. Astghik would like a loan to purchase feed for the livestock and fuel for the harvesting machinery. This investment should increase the family income by 10%. She is pleased with the microfinance services available to her and the assistance meeting the family’s financial needs. With limited economic opportunities in Vahramaberd, most of the villagers are engaged in farming. Astghik enjoys the rural lifestyle and living near her close relatives.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fuel

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Buikwe Group

texts.en: 40-year-old Robinah has had a farming business in Lugazi for the last 20 years. She is a happily married mother of four. She also has a second business: a retail shop. Both of these businesses are indispensable to her family. Her retail business has been very busy lately. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, cooking oil, etc. Her farming business generates 200,000 UGX in income each month. She intends to use her loan to purchase more commodities for her retail shop, such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc. Her retail shop often runs short on inventory.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc. to resell

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Sheila has been in this business for three years. Sheila earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase items like blouses and pants to sell to customers.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like blouses and pants to sell to customers.
